pages.title: Omnitruncated simplectic honeycomb
pages.text:
In [[geometry]] an '''omnitruncated simplectic honeycomb''' or '''omnitruncated n-simplex honeycomb''' is an n-dimensional [[Uniform honeycomb|uniform tessellation]], based on the symmetry of the {\tilde{A}}_n affine [[Coxeter group]]. Each is composed of [[omnitruncation (geometry)|omnitruncated]] [[simplex]] [[Facet (geometry)|facets]]. The [[vertex figure]] for each is an irregular n-simplex. The facets of an ''omnitruncated simplectic honeycomb'' are called [[permutahedron|permutahedra]] and can be positioned in ''n+1'' space with integral coordinates, permutations of the whole numbers (0,1,..,n). {| class="wikitable" width=800 !height=30|n !{\tilde{A}}_{1+} !Image !Tessellation !Facets !Vertex figure !Facets per vertex figure !Vertices per vertex figure |- |1 |{\tilde{A}}_1 |[[File:Uniform apeirogon.png|80px]] |[[Apeirogon]]
{{CDD|node_1|infin|node_1}} |[[Line segment]] |Line segment |1 |2 |- |[[Template:A2 honeycombs|2]] |{\tilde{A}}_2 |[[Image:Uniform tiling 333-t012.png|80px]] |[[Hexagonal tiling]]
{{CDD|node_1|split1|branch_11}} |[[File:2-simplex_t01.svg|100px]]
[[hexagon]] |[[Equilateral triangle]]
[[File:Hexagonal_tiling_vertfig.png|100px]] |3 [[hexagon]]s |3 |- |[[Template:A3 honeycombs|3]] |{\tilde{A}}_3 |[[File:Bitruncated_cubic_honeycomb2.png|80px]] |[[Bitruncated cubic honeycomb]]
{{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes_11|split2|node_1}} |[[File:3-cube t12 B2.svg|100px]]
[[Truncated octahedron]] |irr. [[tetrahedron]]
[[File:Omnitruncated 3-simplex honeycomb verf.png|100px]] |4 [[truncated octahedron]] |4 |- |[[Template:A4 honeycombs|4]] |{\tilde{A}}_4 | |[[Omnitruncated 4-simplex honeycomb]]
{{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes_11|3ab|branch_11}} |[[File:4-simplex_t0123.svg|100px]]
[[Omnitruncated 4-simplex]] |irr. [[5-cell]]
[[File:Omnitruncated 4-simplex honeycomb verf.png|100px]] |5 [[omnitruncated 4-simplex]] |5 |- |[[Template:A5 honeycombs|5]] |{\tilde{A}}_5 | |[[Omnitruncated 5-simplex honeycomb]]
{{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes_11|3ab|nodes_11|split2|node_1}} |[[File:5-simplex_t01234.svg|100px]]
[[Omnitruncated 5-simplex]] |irr. [[5-simplex]]
[[File:Omnitruncated 5-simplex honeycomb verf.png|100px]] |6 [[omnitruncated 5-simplex]] |6 |- |[[Template:A6 honeycombs|6]] |{\tilde{A}}_6 | |[[Omnitruncated 6-simplex honeycomb]]
{{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes_11|3ab|nodes_11|3ab|branch_11}} |[[File:6-simplex_t012345.svg|100px]]
[[Omnitruncated 6-simplex]] |irr. [[6-simplex]]
[[File:Omnitruncated 6-simplex honeycomb verf.png|100px]] |7 [[omnitruncated 6-simplex]] |7 |- |[[Template:A7 honeycombs|7]] |{\tilde{A}}_7 | |[[Omnitruncated 7-simplex honeycomb]]
{{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes_11|3ab|nodes_11|3ab|nodes_11|split2|node_1}} |[[File:7-simplex_t0123456.svg|100px]]
[[Omnitruncated 7-simplex]] |irr. [[7-simplex]]
[[File:Omnitruncated 7-simplex honeycomb verf.png|100px]] |8 [[omnitruncated 7-simplex]] |8 |- |[[Template:A8 honeycombs|8]] |{\tilde{A}}_8 | |[[Omnitruncated 8-simplex honeycomb]]
{{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes_11|3ab|nodes_11|3ab|nodes_11|3ab|branch_11}} |[[File:8-simplex_t01234567_A7.svg|100px]]
[[Omnitruncated 8-simplex]] |irr. [[8-simplex]]
[[File:Omnitruncated_8-simplex_honeycomb_verf.png|100px]] |9 [[omnitruncated 8-simplex]] |9 |} == Projection by folding == The (2n-1)-simplex honeycombs can be projected into the n-dimensional [[Omnitruncation|omnitruncated]] [[hypercubic honeycomb]] by a [[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Geometric folding|geometric folding]] operation that maps two pairs of mirrors into each other, sharing the same [[vertex arrangement]]: {|class=wikitable |- !{\tilde{A}}_3 |{{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes_11|split2|node_1}} !{\tilde{A}}_5 |{{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes_11|3ab|nodes_11|split2|node_1}} !{\tilde{A}}_7 |{{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes_11|3ab|nodes_11|3ab|nodes_11|split2|node_1}} !{\tilde{A}}_9 |{{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes_11|3ab|nodes_11|3ab|nodes_11|3ab|nodes_11|split2|node_1}} |... |- !{\tilde{C}}_2 |{{CDD|node_1|4|node_1|4|node_1}} !{\tilde{C}}_3 |{{CDD|node_1|4|node_1|3|node_1|4|node_1}} !{\tilde{C}}_4 |{{CDD|node_1|4|node_1|3|node_1|3|node_1|4|node_1}} !{\tilde{C}}_5 |{{CDD|node_1|4|node_1|3|node_1|3|node_1|3|node_1|4|node_1}} |... |} == See also== * [[Hypercubic honeycomb]] * [[Alternated hypercubic honeycomb]] * [[Quarter hypercubic honeycomb]] * [[Simplectic honeycomb]] * [[Truncated simplectic honeycomb]] == References == * George Olshevsky, ''Uniform Panoploid Tetracombs'', Manuscript (2006) ''(Complete list of 11 convex uniform tilings, 28 convex uniform honeycombs, and 143 convex uniform tetracombs)'' * [[Branko Grünbaum]], Uniform tilings of 3-space. [[Geombinatorics]] 4(1994), 49 - 56. * [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|Norman Johnson]] ''Uniform Polytopes'', Manuscript (1991) * [[Coxeter|Coxeter, H.S.M.]] ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', (3rd edition, 1973), Dover edition, {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}} * '''Kaleidoscopes: Selected Writings of H.S.M. Coxeter''', edited by F. Arthur Sherk, Peter McMullen, Anthony C. Thompson, Asia Ivic Weiss, Wiley-Interscience Publication, 1995, {{isbn|978-0-471-01003-6}} [http://www.wiley.com/WileyCDA/WileyTitle/productCd-0471010030.html] ** (Paper 22) H.S.M. Coxeter, ''Regular and Semi Regular Polytopes I'', [Math. Zeit. 46 (1940) 380-407, MR 2,10] (1.9 Uniform space-fillings) ** (Paper 24) H.S.M. Coxeter, ''Regular and Semi-Regular Polytopes III'', [Math. Zeit. 200 (1988) 3-45] {{Honeycombs}} [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]] [[Category:Polytopes]] [[Category:Truncated tilings]]

It has [[omnitruncated tesseract]], [[truncated cuboctahedral prism]], and [[8-8 duoprism]] facets in an irregular [[5-cell]] [[vertex figure]]. == Related honeycombs== {{C4_honeycombs}} == See also == * [[Truncated square tiling]] * [[Omnitruncated cubic honeycomb]] Regular and uniform honeycombs in 4-space: *[[Tesseractic honeycomb]] *[[16-cell honeycomb]] *[[24-cell honeycomb]] *[[Truncated 24-cell honeycomb]] *[[Snub 24-cell honeycomb]] * [[5-cell honeycomb]] * [[Truncated 5-cell honeycomb]] * [[Omnitruncated 5-cell honeycomb]] == References == * [[Coxeter|Coxeter, H.S.M.]] ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', (3rd edition, 1973), Dover edition, {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}} p. 296, Table II: Regular honeycombs * '''Kaleidoscopes: Selected Writings of H.S.M. Coxeter''', edited by F. Arthur Sherk, [[Peter McMullen]], Anthony C. Thompson, Asia Ivic Weiss, Wiley-Interscience Publication, 1995, {{isbn|978-0-471-01003-6}} [http://www.wiley.com/WileyCDA/WileyTitle/productCd-0471010030.html] ** (Paper 24) H.S.M. pages.title: Order-4 24-cell honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4 24-cell honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|(No image) |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List_of_regular_polytopes#Tessellations_of_hyperbolic_4-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{3,4,3,4}
{3,4,31,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node|3|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node|split1|nodes}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node|3|node|4|node_h0}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|4-faces||[[File:Schlegel_wireframe_24-cell.png|50px]] [[24-cell|{3,4,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[File:Octahedron.png|30px]] [[Octahedron|{3,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[File:Regular_polygon_3_annotated.svg|30px]] [[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Face figure||[[File:Regular_polygon_4_annotated.svg|30px]] [[Square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[File:Octahedron.png|30px]] [[Octahedron|{3,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[File:Cubic_honeycomb.png|50px]] [[Cubic honeycomb|{4,3,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Cubic honeycomb honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|R}}4, [4,3,4,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 4-space]], the '''order-4 24-cell honeycomb''' is one of two paracompact [[regular polytope|regular]] space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycombs]]). It is called ''paracompact'' because it has infinite [[vertex figures]], with all vertices as [[ideal point]]s at infinity. With [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,4,3,4}, it has four [[24-cell]]s around each face. It is [[dual polytope|dual]] to the [[cubic honeycomb honeycomb]]. == Related honeycombs== It is related to the regular Euclidean 4-space [[24-cell honeycomb]], {3,4,3,3}, with [[24-cell]] facets. == See also == * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) *[[H.S.M. pages.title: Order-4 24-cell honeycomb honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4 24-cell honeycomb honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|(No image) |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List_of_regular_polytopes#Tessellations_of_hyperbolic_5-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{3,4,3,3,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node|3|node|3|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node|3|node|split1|nodes}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node|3|node|3|node|4|node_h0}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|5-faces||[[File:Icositetrachoronic tetracomb.png|50px]] [[24-cell honeycomb|{3,4,3,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|4-faces||[[File:Schlegel wireframe 24-cell.png|50px]] [[24-cell|{3,4,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[File:Octahedron.png|50px]] [[Octahedron|{3,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[File:Regular_polygon_3_annotated.svg|50px]] [[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cell figure||[[File:Regular_polygon_4_annotated.svg|50px]] [[Square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Face figure||[[File:Octahedron.png|50px]] [[Octahedron|{3,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[File:Schlegel wireframe 16-cell.png|50px]] [[16-cell|{3,3,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[File:Tesseractic tetracomb.png|50px]] [[Tesseractic honeycomb|{4,3,3,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Tesseractic honeycomb honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|R}}5, [3,4,3,3,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 5-space]], the '''order-4 24-cell honeycomb honeycomb''' is one of five paracompact [[regular polytope|regular]] space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycombs]]). It is called ''paracompact'' because it has infinite [[vertex figures]], with all vertices as [[ideal point]]s at infinity. With [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,4,3,3,4}, it has four [[24-cell honeycomb]]s around each cell. It is [[dual polytope|dual]] to the [[tesseractic honeycomb honeycomb]]. == Related honeycombs== It is related to the regular Euclidean 4-space [[24-cell honeycomb]], {3,4,3,3}, as well as the hyperbolic 5-space order-3 [[24-cell honeycomb honeycomb]], {3,4,3,3,3}. == See also == * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{ISBN|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'', Dover Publications, 1999 {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10: Regular honeycombs in hyperbolic space, Summary tables II,III,IV,V, p212-213) [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

pages.title: Order-4 120-cell honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4 120-cell honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|(No image) |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List_of_regular_polytopes#Tessellations_of_hyperbolic_4-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{5,3,3,4}
{5,3,31,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|3|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|split1|nodes}} = {{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|3|node|4|node_h0}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|4-faces||[[File:Schlegel_wireframe_120-cell.png|50px]] [[120-cell|{5,3,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[File:Dodecahedron.png|30px]] [[Dodecahedron|{5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[File:Regular_polygon_5_annotated.svg|30px]] [[Pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Face figure||[[File:Regular_polygon_4_annotated.svg|30px]] [[Square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[File:Octahedron.svg|30px]] [[octahedron|{3,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[File:Schlegel_wireframe_16-cell.png|50px]] [[600-cell|{3,3,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-5 tesseractic honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}4, [5,3,3,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 4-space]], the '''order-4 120-cell honeycomb''' is one of five compact [[regular polytope|regular]] space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycombs]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] {5,3,3,4}, it has four [[120-cell]]s around each face. Its [[dual polytope|dual]] is the [[order-5 tesseractic honeycomb]], {4,3,3,5}. == Related honeycombs== It is related to the (order-3) [[120-cell honeycomb]], and [[order-5 120-cell honeycomb]]. It is analogous to the [[order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb]] and [[order-4 pentagonal tiling]]. == See also == * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'', Dover Publications, 1999 {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10: Regular honeycombs in hyperbolic space, Summary tables II,III,IV,V, p212-213) [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

pages.title: Cubic-icosahedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cubic-icosahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{(4,3,5,3)} or {(3,5,3,4)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|label5|branch|3ab|branch_10l|label4}} or {{CDD|label5|branch|3ab|branch_01l|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Cube|{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t0.png|40px]]
[[icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]]
[[cuboctahedron|r{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t1.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3}
[[square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t2_5343_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[icosidodecahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[(5,3,4,3)] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''cubic-icosahedral honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[icosahedron]], [[cube]], and [[cuboctahedron]] cells, in a [[icosidodecahedron]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a single-ring Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|label5|branch|3ab|branch_10l|label4}}, and is named by its two regular cells. {{Honeycomb}} == Images== {| class=wikitable |+ Wide-angle perspective view |- align=center |[[File:H3 4353-1000 center ultrawide.png|480px]]

Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'', Dover Publications, 1999 {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10: Regular honeycombs in hyperbolic space, Summary tables II,III,IV,V, p212-213) * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{isbn|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapter 16-17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|Norman Johnson]] ''Uniform Polytopes'', Manuscript ** [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|N.W. pages.title: Cubic-octahedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="300" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cube-octahedron honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{(3,4,3,4)} or {(4,3,4,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label4|branch_10r|3ab|branch|label4}} or {{CDD|label4|branch_01r|3ab|branch|label4}} or
{{CDD|label4|branch|3ab|branch_10l|label4}} or {{CDD|label4|branch|3ab|branch_01l|label4}}
{{CDD|node_1|splitplit1u|branch3u|3a3buc-cross|branch3u_11|splitplit2u|node}} ↔ {{CDD|branchu_01r|3ab|branch_10lru|split2-44|node|labelh}} ↔ {{CDD|branch_10r|4a4b|branch|labels|}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Cube|{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t0.png|40px]]
[[Octahedron|{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t2.png|40px]]
[[Cuboctahedron|r{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t1.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}
[[square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t0_4343_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[rhombicuboctahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[(4,3)[2]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''cube-octahedron honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[cube]], [[octahedron]], and [[cuboctahedron]] cells, in a [[rhombicuboctahedron]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a single-ring Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|label4|branch_10r|3ab|branch|label4}}, and is named by its two regular cells. {{Honeycomb}} == Images== Wide-angle perspective views: File:H3 4343-0010 center ultrawide.png|Centered on cube File:H3 4343-1000 center ultrawide.png|Centered on octahedron File:H3 4343-0001 center ultrawide.png|Centered on cuboctahedron It contains a subgroup H2 tiling, the [[alternated order-4 hexagonal tiling]], {{CDD|nodes_11|3a3b-cross|nodes}}, with vertex figure (3.4)4. : [[File:Uniform tiling verf 34343434.png|240px]] == Symmetry== A lower symmetry form, index 6, of this honeycomb can be constructed with [(4,3,4,3*)] symmetry, represented by a [[trigonal trapezohedron]] fundamental domain, and [[Coxeter diagram]] {{CDD|node_1|splitplit1u|branch3u|3a3buc-cross|branch3u_11|splitplit2u|node}}. This lower symmetry can be extended by restoring one mirror as {{CDD|branchu_01r|3ab|branch_10lru|split2-44|node}}. {| class=wikitable |+ Cells |- | {{CDD|nodes_11|2|node_1}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|4|node_g|3sg|node_g}}
[[File:Uniform polyhedron 222-t012.png|40px]] = [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t0.png|40px]] | {{CDD|nodes|split2|node_1}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h0|4|node|3|node_1}}
[[File:Uniform_polyhedron-33-t1.png|40px]] = [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t2.png|40px]] |{{CDD|nodes_11|split2|node}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h0|4|node_1|3|node}}
[[File:Uniform_polyhedron-33-t02.png|40px]] = [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t1.png|40px]] |} == Related honeycombs== There are 5 related uniform honeycombs generated within the same family, generated with 2 or more rings of the Coxeter group {{CDD|label4|branch|3ab|branch|label4}}: {{CDD|label4|branch_10r|3ab|branch_10l|label4}}, {{CDD|label4|branch_01r|3ab|branch_10l|label4}}, {{CDD|label4|branch_11|3ab|branch|label4}}, {{CDD|label4|branch_11|3ab|branch_10l|label4}}, {{CDD|label4|branch_11|3ab|branch_11|label4}}. === Rectified cubic-octahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="300" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Rectified cubic-octahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||r{(4,3,4,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label4|branch_01r|3ab|branch_10l|label4}} or {{CDD|label4|branch_10r|3ab|branch_01l|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Cuboctahedron|r{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t1.png|40px]]
[[rhombicuboctahedron|rr{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t02.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}
[[octagon]] {8} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t02_4343_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[cuboid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[[(4,3)[2]]], {{CDD|label4|branch_c1-2|3ab|branch_c2-1|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The '''rectified cubic-octahedral honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[cuboctahedron]], and [[rhombicuboctahedron]] cells, in a [[cuboid]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a Coxeter diagram {{CDD|label4|branch_01r|3ab|branch_10l|label4}}. [[File:H3_4343-1010_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] :Perspective view from center of rhombicuboctahedron {{-}} === Cyclotruncated cubic-octahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="300" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cyclotruncated cubic-octahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||ct{(4,3,4,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label4|branch_11|3ab|branch|label4}} or {{CDD|label4|branch|3ab|branch_11|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Truncated cube|t{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t01.png|40px]]
[[octahedron|{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}
[[octagon]] {8} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t01_4343_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[square antiprism]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[[(4,3)[2]]], {{CDD|label4|branch_c1|3ab|branch_c2|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The '''cyclotruncated cubic-octahedral honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[truncated cube]], [[octahedron]] cells, in a [[square antiprism]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a Coxeter diagram {{CDD|label4|branch_11|3ab|branch|label4}}. [[File:H3_4343-1100_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] :Perspective view from center of octahedron It can be seen as somewhat analogous to the [[trioctagonal tiling]] with truncated square and triangle facets: : [[File:Uniform tiling 433-t01.png|160px]] {{-}} === Cyclotruncated octahedral-cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="300" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cyclotruncated octahedral-cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||ct{(3,4,3,4)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label4|branch_10r|3ab|branch_10l|label4}} or {{CDD|label4|branch_01r|3ab|branch_01l|label4}}
{{CDD|node_1|splitplit1u|branch3u_11|3a3buc-cross|branch3u_11|splitplit2u|node_1}} ↔ {{CDD|branchu_11|3ab|branch_11|split2-44|node|labelh}} ↔ {{CDD|branch_11|4a4b|branch|labels|}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Cube|{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t0.png|40px]]
[[Truncated octahedron|t{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t12.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t12_4343_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[triangular antiprism]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[[(4,3)[2]]], {{CDD|label4|branch_c1-2|3ab|branch_c1-2|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The '''cyclotruncated octahedral-cubic honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[cube]], [[truncated octahedron]] cells, in a [[triangular antiprism]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a Coxeter diagram {{CDD|label4|branch_10r|3ab|branch_10l|label4}}. [[File:H3_4343-0110_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] :Perspective view from center of cube It contains an H2 subgroup [[tetrahexagonal tiling]] alternating square and hexagonal faces, with Coxeter diagram {{CDD|branch_11|split2-44|node}} or half symmetry {{CDD|nodes_11|3a3b-cross|nodes_11}}: : [[File:H2 tiling 344-5.png|160px]] [[File:3222-uniform_tiling-verf4646.png|160px]] ==== Symmetry==== {| class=wikitable width=360 align=right |+ Fundamental domains |- valign=top |[[File:Trigonal_trapezohedron_hyperboic_fundamental_domain.png|120px]]
[[Trigonal trapezohedron]]
{{CDD|node_c1|splitplit1u|branch3u_c2|3a3buc-cross|branch3u_c1|splitplit2u|node_c2}} ↔ {{CDD|branch_c1-2|4a4b|branch|labels}} |[[File:Trigonal trapezohedron hyperbolic fundamental half domain.png|120px]]
Half domain
{{CDD|node_c1|splitplit1u|branch3u_c2|3a3buc-cross|branch3u_c3|splitplit2u|node_c4}} ↔ {{CDD|branchu_c1-4|3ab|branch_c2-3|split2-44|node|labelh}} |[[File:H2chess 246a.png|120px]]
'''H'''2 subgroup, rhombic [[3232 symmetry|*3232]]
{{CDD|nodeab_c2|3a3b-cross|nodeab_c3}} ↔ {{CDD|branch_c2-3|split2-44|node|labelh}} |} A radial subgroup symmetry, index 6, of this honeycomb can be constructed with [(4,3,4,3*)], {{CDD|branch_11|4a4b|branch|labels}}, represented by a [[trigonal trapezohedron]] fundamental domain, and [[Coxeter diagram]] {{CDD|node_1|splitplit1u|branch3u_11|3a3buc-cross|branch3u_11|splitplit2u|node_1}}. This lower symmetry can be extended by restoring one mirror as {{CDD|branchu_11|3ab|branch_11|split2-44|node}}. {| class=wikitable |+ Cells |- |{{CDD|nodes_11|2|node_1}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|4|node_g|3sg|node_g}}
[[File:Uniform polyhedron 222-t012.png|40px]] = [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t0.png|40px]] |colspan=2|{{CDD|nodes_11|split2|node_1}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h0|4|node_1|3|node_1}}
[[File:Uniform_polyhedron-33-t012.png|40px]] = [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t12.png|40px]] |} {{-}} === Truncated cubic-octahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="300" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Truncated cubic-octahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||t{(4,3,4,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label4|branch_11|3ab|branch_10l|label4}} or {{CDD|label4|branch_10r|3ab|branch_11|label4}} or
{{CDD|label4|branch_11|3ab|branch_01l|label4}} or {{CDD|label4|branch_01r|3ab|branch_11|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[truncated octahedron|t{3,4}]] [[Image:truncated octahedron.png|40px]]
[[truncated cube|t{4,3}]] [[Image:truncated hexahedron.png|40px]]
[[rhombicuboctahedron|rr{3,4}]] [[Image:small rhombicuboctahedron.png|40px]]
[[truncated cuboctahedron|tr{4,3}]] [[Image:great rhombicuboctahedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6}
[[octagon]] {8} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t012_4343_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[square pyramid|rectangular pyramid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[(4,3)[2]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''truncated cubic-octahedral honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[truncated octahedron]], [[truncated cube]], [[rhombicuboctahedron]], [[truncated cuboctahedron]] cells, in a [[square pyramid|rectangular pyramid]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a Coxeter diagram {{CDD|label4|branch_11|3ab|branch_10l|label4}}. [[File:H3_4343-1110_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] :Perspective view from center of rhombicuboctahedron {{-}} === Omnitruncated cubic-octahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="300" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Omnitruncated cubic-octahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||tr{(4,3,4,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label4|branch_11|3ab|branch_11|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[truncated cuboctahedron|tr{3,4}]] [[Image:great rhombicuboctahedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6}
[[octagon]] {8} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t0123_4343_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[Rhombic disphenoid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[2[(4,3)[2]]] or [(2,2)+[(4,3)[2]]], {{CDD|label4|branch_c1|3ab|branch_c1|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive, cell-transitive |} The '''omnitruncated cubic-octahedral honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[truncated cuboctahedron]] cells, in a [[rhombic disphenoid]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a Coxeter diagram {{CDD|label4|branch_11|3ab|branch_11|label4}} with [2,2]+ (order 4) extended symmetry in its [[rhombic disphenoid]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3_4343-1111_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] :Perspective view from center of truncated cuboctahedron {{-}} == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'', Dover Publications, 1999 {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10: Regular honeycombs in hyperbolic space, Summary tables II,III,IV,V, p212-213) * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{isbn|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapter 16-17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|Norman Johnson]] ''Uniform Polytopes'', Manuscript ** [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|N.W. Johnson]]: ''The Theory of Uniform Polytopes and Honeycombs'', Ph.D. Dissertation, University of Toronto, 1966 ** N.W. Johnson: ''Geometries and Transformations'', (2018) Chapter 13: Hyperbolic Coxeter groups {{DEFAULTSORT:Order-4 Dodecahedral Honeycomb}} [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

pages.title: Cubic-triangular tiling honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cubic-triangular tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{(3,6,3,4)} or {(4,3,6,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label6|branch|3ab|branch_10l|label4}} or {{CDD|label6|branch|3ab|branch_01l|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Cube|{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t0.png|40px]]
[[Triangular tiling|{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform_tiling 63-t2.png|40px]]
[[cuboctahedron|r{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t1.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}

[[hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform tiling 63-t02.png|80px]]
[[rhombitrihexagonal tiling]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[(6,3,4,3)] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''cubic-triangular tiling honeycomb''' is a [[paracompact uniform honeycomb]], constructed from [[cube]], [[triangular tiling]], and [[cuboctahedron]] cells, in a [[rhombitrihexagonal tiling]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a single-ring Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|label6|branch|3ab|branch_10l|label4}}, and is named by its two regular cells. {{Honeycomb}} == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == *[[H.S.M. pages.title: Dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{(3,5,3,5)} or {(5,3,5,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|label5|branch_10r|3ab|branch|label5}} or {{CDD|label5|branch_01r|3ab|branch|label5}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Dodecahedron|{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t0.png|40px]]
[[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]]
[[icosidodecahedron|r{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t1.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}
[[pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t0_5353_honeycomb_verf.png|120px]]
[[rhombicosidodecahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[(5,3)[2]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb''' is a uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[dodecahedron]], [[icosahedron]], and [[icosidodecahedron]] cells, in a [[rhombicosidodecahedron]] [[vertex figure]]. {{Honeycomb}} == Images== Wide-angle perspective views: File:H3 5353-0010 center ultrawide.png|Centered on dodecahedron File:H3 5353-1000 center ultrawide.png|Centered on icosahedron == Related honeycombs== There are 5 related uniform honeycombs generated within the same family, generated with 2 or more rings of the Coxeter group {{CDD|label5|branch|3ab|branch|label5}}: {{CDD|label5|branch_10r|3ab|branch_10l|label5}}, {{CDD|label5|branch_01r|3ab|branch_10l|label5}}, {{CDD|label5|branch_11|3ab|branch|label5}}, {{CDD|label5|branch_11|3ab|branch_10l|label5}}, {{CDD|label5|branch_11|3ab|branch_11|label5}}. === Rectified dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Rectified dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||r{(5,3,5,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label5|branch_01r|3ab|branch_10l|label5}} or {{CDD|label5|branch_10r|3ab|branch_01l|label5}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[icosidodecahedron|r{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t1.png|40px]]
[[rhombicosidodecahedron|rr{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t02.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}
[[decagon]] {10} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t02_5353_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[cuboid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[[(5,3)[2]]], {{CDD|label5|branch_c1-2|3ab|branch_c2-1|label5}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The '''rectified dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[icosidodecahedron]], and [[rhombicosidodecahedron]] cells, in a [[cuboid]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a Coxeter diagram {{CDD|label5|branch_01r|3ab|branch_10l|label5}}. [[File:H3_5353-1010_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] :Perspective view from center of rhombicosidodecahedron {{-}} === Cyclotruncated dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cyclotruncated dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||ct{(5,3,5,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label5|branch_11|3ab|branch|label5}} or {{CDD|label5|branch|3ab|branch_11|label5}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Truncated dodecahedron|t{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t01.png|40px]]
[[icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}
[[decagon]] {10} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t01_5353_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[square antiprism]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[[(5,3)[2]]], {{CDD|label5|branch_c1|3ab|branch_c2|label5}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The '''cyclotruncated dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[truncated dodecahedron]], [[icosahedron]] cells, in a [[square antiprism]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a Coxeter diagram {{CDD|label5|branch_11|3ab|branch|label5}}. [[File:H3_5353-1100_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] :Perspective view from center of icosahedron {{-}} === Cyclotruncated icosahedral-dodecahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cyclotruncated icosahedral-dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||ct{(3,5,3,5)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label5|branch_10r|3ab|branch_10l|label5}} or {{CDD|label5|branch_01r|3ab|branch_01l|label5}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[dodecahedron|{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t0.png|40px]]
[[Truncated icosahedron|t{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t12.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t12_5353_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[triangular antiprism]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[[(5,3)[2]]], {{CDD|label5|branch_c1-2|3ab|branch_c1-2|label5}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The '''cyclotruncated icosahedral-dodecahedral honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[dodecahedron]], [[truncated icosahedron]] cells, in a [[triangular antiprism]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a Coxeter diagram {{CDD|label5|branch_10r|3ab|branch_10l|label5}}. [[File:H3_5353-0110_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] :Perspective view from center of dodecahedron It can be see as somewhat analogous to the [[pentahexagonal tiling]] with pentagonal and hexagonal faces: : [[File:H2 tiling 355-5.png|160px]] {{-}} === Truncated dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Truncated dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||t{(5,3,5,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label5|branch_11|3ab|branch_10l|label5}} or {{CDD|label5|branch_10r|3ab|branch_11|label5}} or
{{CDD|label5|branch_11|3ab|branch_01l|label5}} or {{CDD|label5|branch_01r|3ab|branch_11|label5}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[truncated icosahedron|t{3,5}]] [[Image:truncated icosahedron.png|40px]]
[[truncated dodecahedron|t{5,3}]] [[Image:truncated dodecahedron.png|40px]]
[[rhombicosidodecahedron|rr{3,5}]] [[Image:small rhombicosidodecahedron.png|40px]]
[[truncated icosidodecahedron|tr{5,3}]] [[Image:great rhombicosidodecahedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6}
[[decagon]] {10} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t012_5353_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[square pyramid|trapezoidal pyramid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[(5,3)[2]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''truncated dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[truncated icosahedron]], [[truncated dodecahedron]], [[rhombicosidodecahedron]], [[truncated icosidodecahedron]] cells, in a [[square pyramid|trapezoidal pyramid]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a Coxeter diagram {{CDD|label5|branch_11|3ab|branch_10l|label5}}. [[File:H3_5353-1101_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] :Perspective view from center of truncated icosahedron {{-}} === Omnitruncated dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Omnitruncated dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||tr{(5,3,5,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label5|branch_11|3ab|branch_11|label5}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[truncated icosidodecahedron|tr{3,5}]] [[Image:great rhombicosidodecahedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6}
[[decagon]] {10} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t0123_5353_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[Rhombic disphenoid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[(2,2)+[(5,3)[2]]], {{CDD|label5|branch_c1|3ab|branch_c1|label5}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive, cell-transitive |} The '''omnitruncated dodecahedral-icosahedral honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[truncated icosidodecahedron]] cells, in a [[rhombic disphenoid]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a Coxeter diagram {{CDD|label5|branch_11|3ab|branch_11|label5}}. [[File:H3_5353-1111_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] :Perspective view from center of truncated icosidodecahedron {{-}} == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'', Dover Publications, 1999 {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10: Regular honeycombs in hyperbolic space, Summary tables II,III,IV,V, p212-213) * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{isbn|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapter 16-17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|Norman Johnson]] ''Uniform Polytopes'', Manuscript ** [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|N.W. Johnson]]: ''The Theory of Uniform Polytopes and Honeycombs'', Ph.D. Dissertation, University of Toronto, 1966 ** N.W. Johnson: ''Geometries and Transformations'', (2018) Chapter 13: Hyperbolic Coxeter groups {{DEFAULTSORT:Order-4 Dodecahedral Honeycomb}} [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

pages.title: Hyperbolic tetrahedral-octahedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Tetrahedron-octahedron honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]]
[[Semiregular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{(3,4,3,3)} or {(3,3,4,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|label4|branch|3ab|branch_10l}} or {{CDD|label4|branch|3ab|branch_01l}} or {{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes|split2-43|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Tetrahedron|{3,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-33-t0.png|40px]]
[[octahedron|{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t2.png|40px]]
[[Cuboctahedron|r{3,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-33-t1.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t2_4333_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[rhombicuboctahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[(4,3,3,3)] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''tetrahedron-octahedron honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[octahedron]] and [[tetrahedron]] cells, in a [[rhombicuboctahedron]] [[vertex figure]]. {{Honeycomb}} It represents a [[semiregular honeycomb]] as defined by all regular cells, although from the Wythoff construction, rectified tetrahedral r{3,3}, becomes the regular [[octahedron]] {3,4}. == Images== {| class=wikitable |+ Wide-angle perspective view |- align=center |[[File:H3 4333-0100 center ultrawide.png|480px]]
Centered on octahedron |} == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] * [[Tetrahedral-octahedral honeycomb]] - similar Euclidean honeycomb, {{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes|split2|node}} * [[Tetrahedral-cubic honeycomb]] == References == *[[H.S.M. pages.title: Octahedral-hexagonal tiling honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Octahedron-hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{(3,4,3,6)} or {(6,3,4,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label6|branch_10r|3ab|branch|label4}} or {{CDD|label6|branch_01r|3ab|branch|label4}}
[[File:CDel_K6_634_11.png]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Octahedron|{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t2.png|40px]]
[[Hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform_tiling 63-t0.png|40px]]

[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 6343 t0 verf.png|80px]]
[[rhombicuboctahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[(6,3,4,3)] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''octahedron-hexagonal tiling honeycomb''' is a [[paracompact uniform honeycomb]], constructed from [[octahedron]], [[hexagonal tiling]], and [[trihexagonal tiling]] cells, in a [[rhombicuboctahedron]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a single-ring Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|label6|branch_10r|3ab|branch|label4}}, and is named by its two regular cells. {{Honeycomb}} == Symmetry== A lower symmetry form, index 6, of this honeycomb can be constructed with [(6,3,4,3*)] symmetry, represented by a [[trigonal trapezohedron]] fundamental domain, and a [[Coxeter diagram]] [[File:CDel_K6_634_10.png]]. {{-}} == Related honeycombs== === Cyclotruncated octahedral-hexagonal tiling honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="280" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cyclotruncated octahedral-hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||ct{(3,4,3,6)} or ct{(3,6,3,4)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|label6|branch_10r|3ab|branch_10l|label4}} or {{CDD|label6|branch_01r|3ab|branch_01l|label4}}
[[File:CDel_K6_634_11.png]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-63-t0.png|40px]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-63-t12.png|40px]]
[[Cube|{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t0.png|40px]]
[[Truncated octahedron|t{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t12.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform_t12_6343_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[triangular antiprism]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||[(6,3,4,3)] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''cyclotruncated octahedral-hexagonal tiling honeycomb''' is a compact uniform [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]], constructed from [[hexagonal tiling]], [[cube]], and [[truncated octahedron]] cells, in a [[triangular antiprism]] [[vertex figure]]. It has a Coxeter diagram {{CDD|label6|branch_10r|3ab|branch_10l|label4}}. ==== Symmetry==== A radial subgroup symmetry, index 6, of this honeycomb can be constructed with [(4,3,6,3*)], represented by a [[trigonal trapezohedron]] fundamental domain, and [[Coxeter diagram]] [[File:CDel_K6_634_11.png]]. {{-}} == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'', Dover Publications, 1999 {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10: Regular honeycombs in hyperbolic space, Summary tables II,III,IV,V, p212-213) * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{isbn|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapter 16-17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|Norman Johnson]] ''Uniform Polytopes'', Manuscript ** [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|N.W. Johnson]]: ''The Theory of Uniform Polytopes and Honeycombs'', Ph.D. Dissertation, University of Toronto, 1966 ** N.W. Johnson: ''Geometries and Transformations'', (2018) Chapter 13: Hyperbolic Coxeter groups {{DEFAULTSORT:Order-4 Dodecahedral Honeycomb}} [[Category:Hexagonal tilings]] [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

pages.title: Order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|'''Order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb''' |- |bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|[[File:H3_534_CC_center.png|320px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List_of_regular_polytopes#Tessellations_of_hyperbolic_3-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{5,3,4}
{5,31,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|5|node|split1|nodes}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[dodecahedron|{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[square (geometry)|square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Image:Order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[octahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-5 cubic honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4]
{{overline|DH}}3, [5,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular, [[Quasiregular honeycomb]] |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb''' is one of four compact [[regular polytope|regular]] space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycombs]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] {5,3,4}, it has four [[dodecahedron|dodecahedra]] around each edge, and 8 dodecahedra around each vertex in an [[octahedron|octahedral]] arrangement. Its vertices are constructed from 3 orthogonal axes. Its [[dual polytope|dual]] is the [[order-5 cubic honeycomb]]. {{Honeycomb}} ==Description== The [[dihedral angle]] of a dodecahedron is ~116.6°, so it is impossible to fit 4 of them on an edge in Euclidean 3-space. However in hyperbolic space a properly scaled dodecahedron can be scaled so that its dihedral angles are reduced to 90 degrees, and then four fit exactly on every edge. == Symmetry == It is a half symmetry construction, {5,31,1}, with two types (colors) of dodecahedra in the [[Wythoff construction]]. {{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|5|node|split1|nodes}}. == Images == [[File:H2 tiling 245-1.png|240px|thumb|It contains 2D hyperbolic [[order-4 pentagonal tiling]], {5,4}]] [[Image:Hyperbolic orthogonal dodecahedral honeycomb.png|320px]]
[[Beltrami-Klein model]] == Related polytopes and honeycombs == There are four regular compact honeycombs in 3D hyperbolic space: {{Regular compact H3 honeycombs}} There are [[Convex_uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space#.5B5.2C3.2C4.5D_family|fifteen uniform honeycombs]] in the [5,3,4] [[Coxeter group]] family, including this regular form. {{534 family}} There are [[Convex_uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space#.5B5.2C31.2C1.5D_family|eleven uniform honeycombs]] in the bifurcating [5,31,1] Coxeter group family, including this honeycomb in its alternated form. This construction can be represented by alternation (checkerboard) with two colors of dodecahedral cells. This honeycomb is also related to the [[16-cell]], [[cubic honeycomb]], and [[order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb]] all which have octahedral vertex figures: {{Octahedral_vertex_figure_tessellations}} This honeycomb is a part of a sequence of polychora and honeycombs with [[dodecahedral]] cells: {{Dodecahedral_cell_tessellations}} === Rectified order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Rectified order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||r{5,3,4}
r{5,31,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node|5|node_1|3|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node|5|node_1|3|node|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node|5|node_1|split1|nodes}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[icosidodecahedron|r{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t1.png|40px]]
[[octahedron|{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3}
[[pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Rectified order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[cube]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4]
{{overline|DH}}3, [5,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The '''rectified order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb''', {{CDD|node|5|node_1|3|node|4|node}}, has alternating [[octahedron]] and [[icosidodecahedron]] cells, with a [[cube]] [[vertex figure]]. : [[File:H3_534_CC_center_0100.png|240px]][[File:Rectified order 4 dodecahedral honeycomb.png|180px]] [[File:H2 tiling 245-2.png|240px|thumb|It can be seen as analogous to the 2D hyperbolic [[tetrapentagonal tiling]], r{5,4}]] ==== Related honeycombs==== There are four rectified compact regular honeycombs: {{Rectified compact H3 honeycombs}} {{-}} === Truncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Truncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||t{5,3,4}
t{5,31,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|split1|nodes}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Truncated dodecahedron|t{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t01.png|40px]]
[[octahedron|{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3}
[[decagon]] {10} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Truncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[Square pyramid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4]
{{overline|DH}}3, [5,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''truncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb''', {{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node|4|node}}, has [[octahedron]] and [[truncated dodecahedron]] cells, with a [[cube]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 435-0011 center ultrawide.png|480px]] It can be seen as analogous to the 2D hyperbolic [[truncated order-4 pentagonal tiling]], t{5,4} with truncated pentagon and square faces: : [[File:H2 tiling 245-3.png|240px]] ==== Related honeycombs ==== {{Truncated compact H3 honeycombs}} {{-}} === Bitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Bitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb
Bitruncated order-5 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||2t{5,3,4}
2t{5,31,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node|5|node_1|3|node_1|4|node}}
{{CDD|node|5|node_1|3|node_1|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node|5|node_1|split1|nodes_11}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Truncated icosahedron|t{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t12.png|40px]]
[[Truncated octahedron|t{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t12.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Bitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[tetrahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4]
{{overline|DH}}3, [5,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''bitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb''', or '''bitruncated order-5 cubic honeycomb''', {{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node|4|node}}, has [[truncated octahedron]] and [[truncated icosahedron]] cells, with a [[tetrahedron]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 534-0110 center ultrawide.png|480px]] ==== Related honeycombs==== {{Bitruncated compact H3 honeycombs}} {{-}} === Cantellated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cantellated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||rr{5,3,4}
rr{5,31,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node_1|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node_1|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|5|node|split1|nodes_11}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[rhombicosidodecahedron|rr{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t02.png|40px]]
[[cuboctahedron|r{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t2.png|40px]]
{}x{4} [[cube]] [[File:Tetragonal_prism.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Cantellated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[Triangular prism]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4]
{{overline|DH}}3, [5,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''cantellated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb''',{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node_1|4|node}}, has [[rhombicosidodecahedron]] and [[cuboctahedron]], and [[cube]] cells, with a [[triangular prism]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 534-1010 center ultrawide.png|480px]] ==== Related honeycombs==== {{Cantellated compact H3 honeycombs}} {{-}} === Cantitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cantitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||tr{5,3,4}
tr{5,31,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node_1|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node_1|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|split1|nodes_11}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[truncated icosidodecahedron|tr{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t012.png|40px]]
[[truncated octahedron|t{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t12.png|40px]]
{}x{4} [[cube]] [[File:Tetragonal_prism.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6}
[[decagon]] {10} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Cantitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[mirrored sphenoid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4]
{{overline|DH}}3, [5,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''cantitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb''', is a uniform honeycomb constructed with a {{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node_1|4|node}} coxeter diagram, and [[mirrored sphenoid]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 534-1110 center ultrawide.png|480px]] ==== Related honeycombs==== {{Cantitruncated compact H3 honeycombs}} {{-}} === Runcitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Runcitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||t0,1,3{5,3,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node|4|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[truncated dodecahedron|t{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t01.png|40px]]
[[rhombicuboctahedron|rr{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t02.png|40px]]
[[decagonal prism|{}x{10}]] [[File:decagonal_prism.png|40px]]
[[cube|{}x{4}]] [[File:Tetragonal_prism.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[decagon]] {10} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Runcitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
quad [[pyramid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''runcititruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb''', is a uniform honeycomb constructed with a {{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node|4|node_1}} coxeter diagram, and a quadrilateral pyramid [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 534-1101 center ultrawide.png|480px]] ==== Related honeycombs==== {{Runcitruncated compact H3 honeycombs}} == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[Poincaré homology sphere]] Poincaré dodecahedral space * [[Seifert–Weber space]] Seifert–Weber dodecahedral space * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == *[[H.S.M. pages.title: Tetrahedral-dodecahedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Tetrahedral-dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space|Compact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{(5,3,3,3)} or {(3,3,3,5)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|label5|branch_10r|3ab|branch}} or {{CDD|label5|branch_01r|3ab|branch}} or {{CDD|node_1|split1-53|nodes|split2|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Tetrahedron|{3,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-33-t0.png|40px]]
[[Dodecahedron|{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t0.png|40px]]
[[icosidodecahedron|r{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t1.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}

It has a single-ring Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|split1-53|nodes|split2|node}}, and is named by its two regular cells. {{Honeycomb}} == Images== {| class=wikitable |+ Wide-angle perspective views |- align=center |[[File:H3 5333-1000 center ultrawide.png|320px]]

It has a single-ring Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes|split2-53|node}}, and is named by its two regular cells. {{Honeycomb}} It represents a [[semiregular honeycomb]] as defined by all regular cells, although from the Wythoff construction, rectified tetrahedral r{3,3}, becomes the regular [[octahedron]] {3,4}. == Images== {| class=wikitable |+ Wide-angle perspective views |- align=center |[[File:H3 5333-0010 center ultrawide.png|480px]]

pages.title: Order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|[[File:H3 634 FC boundary.png|320px]]
[[Perspective projection]] view
within [[Poincaré disk model]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]]
[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb#.5B6.2C3.2C4.5D family|Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{6,3,4}
{6,31,1}
t0,1{(3,6)2} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1|nodes}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|4|node_h0}}
{{CDD|branch_11|6a6b|branch}}
{{CDD|node|ultra|node_1|split1|branch_11|uaub|nodes}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|6|node_g|3sg|node_g|4|node}}
[[File:CDel K6 636 11.png]] ↔ {{CDD|node_1|6|node_g|3sg|node_g|4g|node_g}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t0.png|40px]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t12.png|40px]] [[File:Uniform tiling 333-t012.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[square (geometry)|square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Image:Order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb verf.png|60px]]
[[octahedron]], {3,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6 cubic honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{{overline|BV}}3, [6,3,4]
{{overline|DV}}3, [6,31,1]
[(6,3)[2]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular, [[quasiregular honeycomb]] |} In the field of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic geometry]], the '''order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''' arises as one of 11 [[Paracompact uniform honeycombs#Regular paracompact honeycombs|regular paracompact honeycombs]] in 3-dimensional [[hyperbolic space]]. It is called '''paracompact''' because it has infinite [[Cell (geometry)|cells]]. Each cell consists of a [[hexagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[horosphere]]: a flat plane in hyperbolic space that approaches a single [[ideal point]] at infinity. {{Honeycomb}} The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb is {6,3,4}. Since that of the [[hexagonal tiling]] of the plane is {6,3}, this honeycomb has four such hexagonal tilings meeting at each edge. Since the Schläfli symbol of the [[octahedron]] is {3,4}, the [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is an octahedron. Thus, 8 hexagonal tilings meet at each vertex of this honeycomb, and the six edges meeting at each vertex lie along three orthogonal axes.Coxeter ''The Beauty of Geometry'', 1999, Chapter 10, Table III == Images== {| class=wikitable width=400 |- valign=top |[[File:Hyperbolic 3d order 4 hexagonal tiling.png|200px]]
Perspective projection |[[File:Order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb cell.png|200px]]
One cell, viewed from outside Poincare sphere |- valign=top |[[File:H2 tiling 33i-7.png|200px]]
The vertices of a [[Template:Order i-3-3 tiling table|t{(3,∞,3)}]], {{CDD|node_1|split1|branch_11|labelinfin}} tiling exists as a 2-[[Hypercycle (geometry)|hypercycle]] within this honeycomb |[[File:Order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb one cell horocycle.png|200px]]
It is analogous to the H2 [[order-4 apeirogonal tiling]], {∞,4}, shown here with one green [[apeirogon]] outlined by its [[horocycle]] |} {{-}} == Symmetry == [[File:Hyperbolic subgroup tree 36.png|thumb|left|Subgroup relations]] It has three reflective simplex symmetry construction. The uniform construction {6,31,1} has two types (colors) of hexagonal tilings in the [[Wythoff construction]]. {{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1|nodes}} A quarter symmetry construction can have four colors of hexagonal tilings: {{CDD|label6|branch_10r|3ab|branch_10l|label6}}. An additional two reflective symmetries exist with nonsimplex fundamental domains:[[Coxeter notation#Extended symmetry|Coxeter notation]]: [6,3*,4], index 6, {{CDD|node|ultra|node_1|split1|branch_11|uaub|nodes}}, and [6,(3,4)*], index 48, with a [[cube]] fundamental domain, and octahedral Coxeter diagram with three axial infinite branches: [[File:CDel K6 636 11.png]]. It can be seen with 8 colors of hexagonal tilings. This honeycomb contains {{CDD|node_1|3|node_1|ultra|node}} that tile 2-[[hypercycle (geometry)|hypercycle]] surfaces, similar to this paracompact tilings, {{CDD|node_1|3|node_1|infin|node}}: : [[File:H2 tiling 23i-6.png|120px]] {{-}} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == === Regular honeycombs=== It is [[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|one of 15 regular hyperbolic honeycombs]] in 3-space, 11 of which like this one are paracompact, with infinite cells or vertex figures. {{Regular_paracompact_H3_honeycombs}} === 634 honeycombs=== There are [[Paracompact uniform honeycomb#.5B6.2C3.2C4.5D family|fifteen uniform honeycombs]] in the [6,3,4] [[Coxeter group]] family, including this regular form, and its [[dual polytope|dual]], the [[order-6 cubic honeycomb]], {4,3,6}. {{634 family}} === Quasiregular honeycombs=== It has a related [[Alternation (geometry)|alternation]] honeycomb, represented by {{CDD|node_h1|6|node|3|node|4|node}} ↔ {{CDD|branch_10ru|split2|node|4|node}}, having [[triangular tiling]] and [[octahedron]] cells. {{Regular and Quasiregular honeycombs}} === Hexagonal tiling cells === It is a part of sequence of regular honeycombs with [[hexagonal tiling]] cells of the form {6,3,p}: {{Hexagonal tiling cell tessellations}} === Octahedral vertex figures=== This honeycomb is also related to the [[16-cell]], [[cubic honeycomb]] and [[order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb]] all which have octahedral vertex figures. {{Octahedral_vertex_figure_tessellations}} === Rectified order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Rectified order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||r{6,3,4} or t1{6,3,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node|6|node_1|3|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|branch_11|split2|node|4|node}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h0|6|node_1|3|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node|6|node_1|split1|nodes}} ↔ {{CDD|node|6|node_1|3|node|4|node_h0}}
{{CDD|node|split1|branch_11|split2|node}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h0|6|node_1|3|node|4|node_h0}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Octahedron|{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-43-t2.png|60px]]
[[Trihexagonal tiling|r{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t1.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
