{{overline|DV}}3, [6,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''runcinated order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''', t0,3{6,3,4}, {{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|4|node_1}} has [[cube]], [[hexagonal tiling]] and [[hexagonal prism]] cells, with a [[triangular antiprism]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 634-1001.png|480px]] It contains the 2D hyperbolic [[rhombitetrahexagonal tiling]], rr{4,6}, {{CDD|node_1|6|node|4|node_1}} with square and hexagonal faces. It also has a half symmetry construction {{CDD|branch_11|2a2b-cross|nodes_11}}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:H2 tiling 246-5.png|240px]] |[[File:Uniform tiling 4.4.4.6.png|240px]] |- !{{CDD|node_1|6|node|4|node_1}} !{{CDD|node_1|6|node_h0|4|node_1}} = {{CDD|branch_11|2a2b-cross|nodes_11}} |} {{-}} === Omnitruncated order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Omnitruncated order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||t0,1,2,3{6,3,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node_1|3|node_1|4|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Truncated cuboctahedron|tr{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-43-t012.png|40px]]
[[truncated trihexagonal tiling|tr{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t012.svg|40px]]
[[Hexagonal prism|{}x{6}]] [[File:Hexagonal prism.png|40px]]
[[cube|{4,3}]] [[File:hexahedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6}
[[dodecagon]] {12} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Omnitruncated order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[tetrahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{{overline|BV}}3, [6,3,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''omnitruncated order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''', t0,1,2,3{6,3,4}, {{CDD|node_1|6|node_1|3|node_1|4|node_1}} has [[truncated cuboctahedron]], [[truncated trihexagonal tiling]], [[hexagonal prism]], and [[cube]] cells, with a [[tetrahedron]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 634-1111.png|480px]] {{-}} === Alternated order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Alternated order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2| |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb#.5B6.2C3.2C4.5D family|Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||h{6,3,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_h1|6|node|3|node|4|node}} ↔ {{CDD|branch_10ru|split2|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|split1|branch_10luru|split2|node}} ↔ {{CDD|branch_10ru|split2|node|4|node_h0}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells|| |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[Hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||{{CDD|node_1|3|node_1|4|node}}
[[truncated octahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{{overline|BV}}3, [6,3,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} {{-}} === Quarter order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Quarter order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||q{6,3,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_h1|6|node|3|node|4|node_h1}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|split1|branch_10luru|split2|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Triangular tiling|{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 333-t0.png|40px]]
[[Tetrahedron|{3,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-33-t0.png|40px]]
[[Truncated tetrahedron|t{3,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-33-t01.png|40px]]
[[Trihexagonal tiling|rr{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 333-t02.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||{3}, {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Paracompact honeycomb DP3 1100 verf.png|80px]]
[[Triangular cupola]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{\bar{DP}}_3, [3[ ]x[ ]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''quarter order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''', q{6,3,4}, {{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|4|node_1}} or {{CDD|node_1|split1|branch_10luru|split2|node}} with a [[triangular cupola]] [[vertex figure]]. {{-}} == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{isbn|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapter 16-17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|Norman Johnson]] ''Uniform Polytopes'', Manuscript ** [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|N.W. Johnson]]: ''The Theory of Uniform Polytopes and Honeycombs'', Ph.D. Dissertation, University of Toronto, 1966 ** N.W. Johnson: ''Geometries and Transformations'', (2018) Chapter 13: Hyperbolic Coxeter groups [[Category:Hexagonal tilings]] [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

pages.title: Order-4 icosahedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4 icosahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{3,5,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|5|node|4|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-4 pentagonal tiling|{5,4}]] [[File:H2 tiling 245-1.png|50px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-5-3 square honeycomb|{4,5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[3,5,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5 icosahedral honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,5,4}. == Geometry== It has four [[icosahedra]] {3,5} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many icosahedra existing around each vertex in an [[order-4 pentagonal tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-5-4 poincare cc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Cell centered) |[[File:H3_354_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,51,1}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-55|nodes}}, with alternating types or colors of icosahedral cells. In [[Coxeter notation]] the half symmetry is [3,5,4,1+] = [3,51,1]. == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It a part of a sequence of [[regular polychora]] and honeycombs with [[icosahedron|icosahedral]] [[cell (geometry)|cells]]: {3,5,''p''} {{Icosahedral cell tessellations}} {{-}} === Order-5 icosahedral honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=280 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5 icosahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{3,5,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|5|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-5 pentagonal tiling|{5,5}]] [[File:H2 tiling 255-4.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[order-5-3 pentagonal honeycomb|{5,5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[3,5,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5 icosahedral honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,5,5}. It has five [[icosahedra]], {3,5}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many icosahedra existing around each vertex in an [[order-5 pentagonal tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-5-5 poincare cc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Cell centered) |[[File:H3_355_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} {{-}} === Order-6 icosahedral honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=280 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-6 icosahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{3,5,6}
{3,(5,∞,5)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|5|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|3|node|5|node|6|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-55|branch}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-6 pentagonal tiling|{5,6}]] [[File:H2 tiling 256-4.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[order-5-3 hexagonal honeycomb|{6,5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[3,5,6] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-6 icosahedral honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,5,6}. It has six [[icosahedra]], {3,5}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many icosahedra existing around each vertex in an [[order-6 pentagonal tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-5-6 poincare cc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Cell centered) |[[File:H3_356_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} {{-}} === Order-7 icosahedral honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=280 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-7 icosahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{3,5,7} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|5|node|7|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[heptagon|{7}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-7 pentagonal tiling|{5,7}]] [[File:H2 tiling 257-4.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[order-5-3 heptagonal honeycomb|{7,5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[3,5,7] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-7 icosahedral honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,5,7}. It has seven [[icosahedra]], {3,5}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many icosahedra existing around each vertex in an [[order-7 pentagonal tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-5-7 poincare cc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Cell centered) |[[File:H3_357_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} {{-}} === Order-8 icosahedral honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=280 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-8 icosahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{3,5,8} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|5|node|8|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[octagon|{8}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-8 pentagonal tiling|{5,8}]] [[File:H2 tiling 258-4.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[order-5-3 octagonal honeycomb|{8,5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[3,5,8] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-8 icosahedral honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,5,8}. It has eight [[icosahedra]], {3,5}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many icosahedra existing around each vertex in an [[order-8 pentagonal tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-5-8 poincare cc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Cell centered) |} {{-}} ===Infinite-order icosahedral honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Infinite-order icosahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{3,5,∞}
{3,(5,∞,5)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|5|node|infin|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|3|node|5|node|infin|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-55|branch|labelinfin}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Apeirogon|{∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Infinite-order pentagonal tiling|{5,∞}]] [[File:H2 tiling 25i-4.png|40px]]
{(5,∞,5)} [[File:H2 tiling 45i-4.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-5-3 apeirogonal honeycomb|{∞,5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[∞,5,3]
[3,((5,∞,5))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''infinite-order icosahedral honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,5,∞}. It has infinitely many [[icosahedra]], {3,5}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many icosahedra existing around each vertex in an [[infinite-order triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-5-i poincare cc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Cell centered) |[[File:H3_35i_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,(5,∞,5)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|3|node|5|node|infin|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-55|branch|labelinfin}}, with alternating types or colors of icosahedral cells. In Coxeter notation the half symmetry is [3,5,∞,1+] = [3,((5,∞,5))]. == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H. S. M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{ISBN|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{ISBN|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapters 16–17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * George Maxwell, ''Sphere Packings and Hyperbolic Reflection Groups'', JOURNAL OF ALGEBRA 79,78-97 (1982) [http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0021869382903180] * Hao Chen, Jean-Philippe Labbé, ''Lorentzian Coxeter groups and Boyd-Maxwell ball packings'', (2013)[https://arxiv.org/abs/1310.8608] * [https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.02851 Visualizing Hyperbolic Honeycombs arXiv:1511.02851] Roice Nelson, Henry Segerman (2015) == External links == *[[John Baez]], ''Visual insights'': [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/01/733-honeycomb/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb] (2014/08/01) [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/14/733-honeycomb-meets-plane-at-infinity/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb Meets Plane at Infinity] (2014/08/14) * [[Danny Calegari]], [http://lamington.wordpress.com/2014/03/04/kleinian-a-tool-for-visualizing-kleinian-groups/Kleinian Kleinian, a tool for visualizing Kleinian groups, Geometry and the Imagination] 4 March 2014. [http://math.uchicago.edu/~dannyc/papers/kleinian_mtf_Feb_2014.pdf] [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

pages.title: Order-4 octahedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4 octahedral tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|[[File:H3 344 CC center.png|320px]]
[[Perspective projection]] view
within [[Poincaré disk model]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]]
[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb#.3B4.2C4.2C4.5D family|Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{3,4,4}
{3,41,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-44|nodes}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node|4|node_h0}}
{{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes|2a2b-cross|nodes}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node_h0|4|node}}
{{CDD|branchu|split2|node_1|split1|branchu}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node_g|4sg|node_g}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[octahedron]] {3,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[square tiling]], {4,4}
[[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 1.png|40px]] [[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 7.png|40px]] [[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 8.png|40px]] [[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 9.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Square tiling honeycomb]], {4,4,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||[4,4,3]
[3,41,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4 octahedral honeycomb''' is a regular paracompact honeycomb. It is called ''paracompact'' because it has infinite [[vertex figure]]s, with all vertices as [[ideal point]]s at infinity. Given by [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,4,4}, it has four [[octahedra]], {3,4} around each edge, and infinite octahedra around each vertex in a [[square tiling]] {4,4} [[vertex arrangement]].Coxeter ''The Beauty of Geometry'', 1999, Chapter 10, Table III {{Honeycomb}} == Symmetry == A half symmetry construction, [3,4,4,1+], exists as {3,41,1}, with alternating two types (colors) of octahedral cells. {{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-44|nodes}}. A second half symmetry, [3,4,1+,4]: {{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node_h0|4|node}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|split1|nodes|2a2b-cross|nodes}}. A higher index subsymmetry, [3,4,4*], index 8, exists with a pyramidal fundamental domain, [((3,∞,3)),((3,∞,3))]: {{CDD|branchu|split2|node_1|split1|branchu}}. This honeycomb contains {{CDD|node_1|split1|branchu}}, {{CDD|node_1|3|node|ultra|node}} that tile 2-[[hypercycle (geometry)|hypercycle]] surfaces, similar to the paracompact tiling {{CDD|node_1|split1|branch|labelinfin}} or {{CDD|node_1|3|node|infin|node}} : [[File:H2chess 23ib.png|120px]] == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It is [[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|one of 15 regular hyperbolic honeycombs]] in 3-space, 11 of which like this one are paracompact, with infinite cells or vertex figures. {{Regular_paracompact_H3_honeycombs}} There are [[Paracompact uniform honeycomb#.5B4.2C4.2C3.5D family|fifteen uniform honeycombs]] in the [4,4,3] [[Coxeter group]] family, including this regular form. {{443_family}} It is a part of a sequence of honeycombs with a [[square tiling]] vertex figure: {{Square tiling vertex figure tessellations}} It a part of a sequence of [[regular polychora]] and honeycombs with [[octahedron|octahedral]] [[cell (geometry)|cells]]. {{Octahedral cell tessellations}} === Rectified order-4 octahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Rectified order-4 octahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||r{3,4,4} or t1{3,4,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node|3|node_1|4|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node|3|node_1|split1-44|nodes}} ↔ {{CDD|node|3|node_1|4|node|4|node_h0}}
{{CDD|node|split1|nodes_11|2a2b-cross|nodes}} ↔ {{CDD|node|3|node_1|4|node_h0|4|node}}
{{CDD|branchu_11|split2|node|split1|branchu_11}} ↔ {{CDD|node|3|node_1|4|node_g|4sg|node_g}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[cuboctahedron|r{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-43-t1.png|40px]]
[[square tiling|{4,4}]][[File:Uniform tiling 44-t0.svg|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangular]] {3}
[[square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Image:Rectified order-4 octahedral honeycomb verf.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||[4,4,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The ''rectified order-4 octahedral honeycomb'', t1{3,4,4}, {{CDD|node|3|node_1|4|node|4|node}} has [[cuboctahedron]] and [[square tiling]] facets, with a [[square prism]] [[vertex figure]]. pages.title: Order-4 square hosohedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4 square hosohedral honeycomb |- align=center |colspan=2|[[File:Order-4 square hosohedral honeycomb-sphere.png|300px]]
Centrally projected onto a sphere |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Degenerate_tessellations_of_Euclidean_3-space|Degenerate regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{2,4,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|2|node|4|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|2|node|infin|node|2|node|infin|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Hosohedron|{2,4}]] [[File:Spherical square hosohedron2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[digon|{2}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[square tiling|{4,4}]]
[[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 1.png|50px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-2 square tiling honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram|Coxeter group]]||[2,4,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In [[geometry]], the '''order-4 square hosohedral honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {2,4,4}. It has 4 [[square hosohedron|square hosohedra]] {2,4} around each edge. It is a degenerate honeycomb in Euclidean space, but can be seen as a projection onto the sphere. Its vertex figure, a [[square tiling]] is seen on each hemisphere. ==Images== [[Stereographic projection]]s of spherical projection, with all edges being projected into circles. {| class=wikitable |- align=center |[[File:Order-4 square hosohedral honeycomb-stereographic.png|400px]]
Centered on pole |- align=center |[[File:Order-4 square hosohedral honeycomb-stereographic2.png|400px]]
Centered on equator |} == Related honeycombs == It is a part of a sequence of honeycombs with a [[square tiling]] vertex figure: {{Square tiling vertex figure tessellations}} === Truncated order-4 square hosohedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-2 square tiling honeycomb
Truncated order-4 square hosohedral honeycomb
[[File:Cubic semicheck.png|240px]]
Partial tessellation with alternately colored cubes |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[uniform convex honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{4,4}×{} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node|2|node_1}}
{{CDD|node|4|node_1|4|node|2|node_1}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node_1|2|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[cube|{3,4}]] [[File:hexahedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Square pyramid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual|| |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram|Coxeter group]]||[2,4,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Uniform |} The {2,4,4} honeycomb can be truncated as t{2,4,4} or {}×{4,4}, Coxeter diagram {{CDD|node_1|2|node_1|4|node|4|node}}, seen as a layer of cubes, partially shown here with alternately colored cubic cells. [[Thorold Gosset]] identified this [[Semiregular polytope|semiregular infinite honeycomb]] as a ''cubic semicheck''. The alternation of this honeycomb, {{CDD|node_h|2x|node_h|4|node|4|node}}, consists of infinite [[square pyramid]]s and infinite [[tetrahedron]]s, between 2 [[square tiling]]s. == See also == * [[Order-6 triangular hosohedral honeycomb]] * [[Order-7 tetrahedral honeycomb]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == {{reflist}} * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

pages.text:
{{See also|Order-3 square tiling honeycomb}} {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4 square tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|[[File:H3 444 FC boundary.png|320px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]]
[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb#.5B4.2C4.2C4.5D family|Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{4,4,4}
h{4,4,4} ↔ {4,41,1}
{4[4]} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|4|node|split1-44|nodes}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|4|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|nodes_10ru|split2-44|node|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|4|node|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node|split1-44|nodes_10luru|split2-44|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node_h0|4|node}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|split1-44|nodes|2a2b-cross|nodes}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node_h0|4|node|4|node}} ↔ {{CDD|nodes_11|2a2b-cross|nodes|split2-44|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node_h0|4|node|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|split1-uu|nodes|2a2b-cross|nodes|split2-uu|node_1}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node_g|4sg|node_g}} ↔ {{CDD|branchu|split2-44|node_1|split1-44|branchu}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node_g|4sg|node_g|4|node}} ↔ {{CDD|branchu_10|2|branchu_10|2|branchu_10|2|branchu_10}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Square tiling|{4,4}]]
[[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 1.png|40px]] [[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 7.png|40px]] [[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 8.png|40px]] [[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 9.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Square tiling]], {4,4}
[[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 1.png|40px]] [[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 7.png|40px]] [[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 8.png|40px]] [[File:Square tiling uniform coloring 9.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||Self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||[4,4,4]
[41,1,1]
[4[4]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular, [[Quasiregular honeycomb|quasiregular]] |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4 square tiling honeycomb''', is one of 11 paracompact regular honeycombs. It is called ''paracompact'' because it has infinite [[Cell (geometry)|cells]] and [[vertex figure]]s, with all vertices as [[ideal point]]s at infinity. Given by [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,4,4}, has four [[square tiling]]s, {4,4} around each edge, and infinite square tilings around each vertex in a [[square tiling]] {4,4} [[vertex arrangement]].Coxeter ''The Beauty of Geometry'', 1999, Chapter 10, Table III {{Honeycomb}} == Symmetry== It has many reflective symmetry constructions, {{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node|4|node}} as a regular honeycomb, {{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|4|node|split1-44|nodes}} with alternate types (colors) of square tilings, and {{CDD|node_1|split1-44|nodes|split2-44|node}} with 3 types (colors) of square tilings, with a ratio of 2:1:1. Two more half symmetry construction with pyramidal domains have [4,4,1+,4] symmetry: {{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node_h0|4|node}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|split1-44|nodes|2a2b-cross|nodes}}, and {{CDD|node_1|4|node_h0|4|node|4|node}} ↔ {{CDD|nodes_11|2a2b-cross|nodes|split2-44|node}}. There are two high index subgroups, both index 8: [4,4,4*] ↔ [(4,4,4,4,1+)] exists with a pyramidal fundamental domain, [((4,∞,4)),((4,∞,4))] or {{CDD|branchu|split2-44|node_1|split1-44|branchu}}, and secondly [4,4*,4], with 4 orthogonal sets of ultraparallel mirrors in an octahedral fundamental domain: {{CDD|branchu_10|2|branchu_10|2|branchu_10|2|branchu_10}}. == Images== It is analogous to the 2D hyperbolic [[infinite-order apeirogonal tiling]], {∞,∞} with infinite apeirogonal faces and all vertices are on the ideal surface. : [[File:H2 tiling 2ii-4.png|160px]] This honeycomb contains {{CDD|node|4|node|ultra|node_1}}, {{CDD|node_1|4|node|ultra|node}} that tile 2-[[hypercycle (geometry)|hypercycle]] surfaces, similar to these paracompact tilings: : [[File:H2 tiling 24i-1.png|120px]] [[File:H2 tiling 24i-4.png|120px]] == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It is [[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|one of 15 regular hyperbolic honeycombs]] in 3-space, 11 of which like this one are paracompact, with infinite cells or vertex figures. {{Regular_paracompact_H3_honeycombs}} There are [[Paracompact uniform honeycomb#.5B4.2C4.2C4.5D family|nine uniform honeycombs]] in the [4,4,4] [[Coxeter group]] family, including this regular form. {{444_family}} It is a part of a sequence of honeycombs with a [[square tiling]] vertex figure: {{Square tiling vertex figure tessellations}} It is a part of a sequence of honeycombs with [[square tiling]] cells: {{Square tiling tessellations}} {{Quasiregular polychora and honeycombs}} === Rectified order-4 square tiling honeycomb === The '''rectified order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''', t1{4,4,4}, {{CDD|node|4|node_1|4|node|4|node}} has [[square tiling]] facets, with a square prism, {{CDD|node_1|2|node_1|4|node}}, [[vertex figure]]. It is the same as the regular [[square tiling honeycomb]], {4,4,3}, {{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node|3|node}}, with a [[cube]] vertex figure, {{CDD|node_1|4|node|3|node}}. [[File:H3 443 FC boundary.png|480px]] {{-}} === Truncated order-4 square tiling honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Truncated order-4 square tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||t{4,4,4} or t0,1{4,4,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|4|node_1|4|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node_1|4|node|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|4|node_1|split1-44|nodes}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node_1|4|node_h0|4|node}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|split1-44|nodes_11|2a2b-cross|nodes}}

pages.title: Order-5 5-cell honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250"
!bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5 5-cell honeycomb
|-
|bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|(No image)

|-

|-

In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 4-space]], the '''order-5 5-cell honeycomb''' is one of five compact [[regular polytope|regular]] space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycombs]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,3,3,5}, it has five [[5-cell]]s around each face. Its [[dual polytope|dual]] is the [[120-cell honeycomb]], {5,3,3,3}.
== Related honeycombs==
It is related to the [[order-5 tesseractic honeycomb]], {4,3,3,5}, and [[order-5 120-cell honeycomb]], {5,3,3,5}.

It is topologically similar to the finite [[5-orthoplex]], {3,3,3,4}, and [[5-simplex]], {3,3,3,3}.

It is analogous to the [[600-cell]], {3,3,5}, and [[icosahedron]], {3,5}.

== See also ==
* [[List of regular polytopes]]

== References ==
*[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296)
*[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'', Dover Publications, 1999 {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10: Regular honeycombs in hyperbolic space, Summary tables II,III,IV,V, p212-213)

[[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

pages.text: {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5 120-cell honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|(No image) |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List_of_regular_polytopes#Tessellations_of_hyperbolic_4-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{5,3,3,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|3|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|4-faces||[[File:Schlegel_wireframe_120-cell.png|50px]] [[120-cell|{5,3,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[File:Dodecahedron.png|30px]] [[Dodecahedron|{5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[File:Regular_polygon_5_annotated.svg|30px]] [[Pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Face figure||[[File:Regular_polygon_5_annotated.svg|30px]] [[Pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[File:Icosahedron.svg|30px]] [[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[File:Schlegel_wireframe_600-cell_vertex-centered.png|50px]] [[600-cell|{3,3,5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||Self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|K}}4, [5,3,3,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 4-space]], the '''order-5 120-cell honeycomb''' is one of five compact [[regular polytope|regular]] space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycombs]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] {5,3,3,5}, it has five [[120-cell]]s around each face. It is self-[[dual polytope|dual]]. == Related honeycombs== It is related to the (order-3) [[120-cell honeycomb]], and [[order-4 120-cell honeycomb]]. It is analogous to the [[order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb]] and [[order-5 pentagonal tiling]]. == Birectified order-5 120-cell honeycomb == The birectified order-5 120-cell honeycomb {{CDD|node|5|node|3|node_1|3|node|5|node}} constructed by all [[rectified 600-cell]]s, with [[octahedron]] and [[icosahedron]] cells, and triangle faces with a 5-5 [[duoprism]] vertex figure and has extended symmetry [[5,3,3,5]]. == See also == * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'', Dover Publications, 1999 {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10: Regular honeycombs in hyperbolic space, Summary tables II,III,IV,V, p212-213) [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]] [[Category:Self-dual tilings]]

pages.title: Order-5 cubic honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|'''Order-5 cubic honeycomb''' |- |bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|[[File:H3_435_CC_center.png|320px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]s |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List_of_regular_polytopes#Tessellations_of_hyperbolic_3-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]]
[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space|Uniform hyperbolic honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]|| {4,3,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|3|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Cell (geometry)|Cells]]||[[cube|{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Face (geometry)|Faces]]||[[square (geometry)|square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex_figure#Edge_figure|Edge figure]]||[[pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[Image:Order-5 cubic honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[icosahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} The '''order-5 cubic honeycomb''' is one of four compact [[regular polytope|regular]] space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]s) in [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]]. With [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,3,5}, it has five [[cube]]s {4,3} around each edge, and 20 cubes around each vertex. It is [[Dual polytope|dual]] with the [[order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb]]. {{Honeycomb}} ==Description == [[File:H2 tiling 245-4.png|200px|thumb|It is analogous to the 2D hyperbolic [[order-5 square tiling]], {4,5}]] {| class=wikitable width=600 |[[File:Order-5 cubic honeycomb cell.png|200px]]
One cell, centered in Poincare ball model |[[Image:Hyperb_gcubic_hc_constr.png|200px]]
Main cells |[[Image:Hyperb_gcubic_hc.png|200px]]
Cells with extended edges to ideal boundary |} == Symmetry == It a radial subgroup symmetry construction with [[dodecahedral]] fundamental domains: [[Coxeter_notation#Extended_symmetry|Coxeter notation]]: [4,(3,5)*], index 120. == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It has a related [[Alternation (geometry)|alternation]] honeycomb, represented by {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node|5|node}} ↔ {{CDD|nodes_10ru|split2|node|5|node}}, having [[icosahedron]] and [[tetrahedron]] cells. === Compact regular honeycombs=== There are four regular compact honeycombs in 3D hyperbolic space: {{Regular compact H3 honeycombs}} === 543 honeycombs=== There are [[Convex_uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space#.5B5.2C3.2C4.5D_family|fifteen uniform honeycombs]] in the [5,3,4] [[Coxeter group]] family, including this regular form: {{534 family}} === Polytopes with icosahedral vertex figures=== It is in a sequence of polychora and honeycomb with [[icosahedron]] [[vertex figure]]s: {{Icosahedral vertex figure tessellations}} === Related polytopes and honeycombs with cubic cells=== It in a sequence of [[regular polychora]] and honeycombs with [[cube|cubic]] [[cell (geometry)|cells]]. The first polytope in the sequence is the [[tesseract]], and the second is the Euclidean [[cubic honeycomb]]. {{Cubic cell tessellations}} === Rectified order-5 cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Rectified order-5 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||r{4,3,5} or 2r{5,3,4}
2r{5,31,1} |- |width=120 bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node|5|node|3|node_1|4|node}}
{{CDD|node|5|node|3|node_1|4|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node|5|node|split1|nodes_11}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Cuboctahedron|r{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t1.png|40px]]
[[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3}
[[square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Rectified_order-5_cubic_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[pentagonal prism]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4]
{{overline|DH}}3, [5,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The '''rectified order-5 cubic honeycomb''', {{CDD|node|5|node|3|node_1|4|node}}, has alternating [[icosahedron]] and [[cuboctahedron]] cells, with a [[pentagonal prism]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3_435_CC_center_0100.png|480px]] ==== Related honeycomb==== [[File:H2 tiling 245-2.png|240px|thumb|It can be seen as analogous to the 2D hyperbolic [[tetrapentagonal tiling]], r{4,5} with square and pentagonal faces]] There are four rectified compact regular honeycombs: {{Rectified compact H3 honeycombs}} {{Pentagonal prism vertex figure tessellations}} {{-}} === Truncated order-5 cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Truncated order-5 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||t{4,3,5} |- |width=120 bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node|5|node|3|node_1|4|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Truncated cube|t{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t01.png|40px]]
[[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Truncated_order-5_cubic_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[pentagonal pyramid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''truncated order-5 cubic honeycomb''', {{CDD|node|5|node|3|node_1|4|node_1}}, has [[truncated cube]] and [[icosahedron]] cells, with a [[pentagonal pyramid]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 534-0011 center ultrawide.png|480px]] It can be seen as analogous to the 2D hyperbolic [[truncated order-5 square tiling]], t{4,5} with truncated square and pentagonal faces: : [[File:H2 tiling 245-6.png|240px]] It is similar to the Euclidean (order-4) [[truncated cubic honeycomb]], t{4,3,4}, with octahedral cells at the truncated vertices. :[[File:Truncated_cubic_honeycomb.png|240px]] ==== Related honeycombs ==== {{Truncated compact H3 honeycombs}} {{-}} === Bitruncated order-5 cubic honeycomb === Same as [[Bitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb]] === Cantellated order-5 cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cantellated order-5 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||rr{4,3,5} |- |width=120 bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node|5|node_1|3|node|4|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[rhombicuboctahedron|rr{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t02.png|40px]]
[[Icosidodecahedron|r{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t1.png|40px]]
[[Pentagonal prism|{}x{5}]] [[File:Pentagonal prism.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Cantellated_order-5_cubic_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[wedge (geometry)|wedge]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''cantellated order-5 cubic honeycomb''', {{CDD|node|5|node_1|3|node|4|node_1}}, has [[rhombicuboctahedron]] and [[icosidodecahedron]] cells, with a [[wedge (geometry)|wedge]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3_534-0101_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] ==== Related honeycombs==== It is similar to the Euclidean (order-4) [[cantellated cubic honeycomb]], rr{4,3,4}: :[[File:Cantellated cubic honeycomb.png|240px]] {{Cantellated compact H3 honeycombs}} {{-}} === Cantitruncated order-5 cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cantitruncated order-5 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||tr{4,3,5} |- |width=120 bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node|5|node_1|3|node_1|4|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[truncated cuboctahedron|tr{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t012.png|40px]]
[[Truncated icosahedron|t{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t12.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[square]] {4}
[[pentagon]] {5}
[[hexagon]] {6}
[[octahedron]] {8} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Cantitruncated_order-5_cubic_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[Mirrored sphenoid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''cantitruncated order-5 cubic honeycomb''', {{CDD|node|5|node_1|3|node|4|node_1}}, has [[rhombicuboctahedron]] and [[icosidodecahedron]] cells, with a [[mirrored sphenoid]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3_534-0111_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] ==== Related honeycombs==== It is similar to the Euclidean (order-4) [[cantitruncated cubic honeycomb]], tr{4,3,4}: :[[File:2-Kuboktaederstumpf 1-Oktaederstumpf 1-Hexaeder.png|240px]] {{Cantitruncated compact H3 honeycombs}} {{-}} === Runcinated order-5 cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Runcinated order-5 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]]
[[Semiregular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||t0,3{4,3,5} |- |width=120 bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|4|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[cube|{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t0.png|40px]]
[[dodecahedron|{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t0.png|40px]]
[[Pentagonal prism|{}x{5}]] [[File:Pentagonal prism.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Square]] {4}
[[Pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Runcinated_order-5_cubic_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[octahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''runcinated order-5 cubic honeycomb''' or '''runcinated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb''' {{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|4|node_1}}, has [[cube]], [[dodecahedron]], and [[pentagonal prism]] cells, with an [[octahedron]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 534-1001 center ultrawide.png|480px]] It is analogous to the 2D hyperbolic [[rhombitetrapentagonal tiling]], rr{4,5}, {{CDD|node_1|5|node|4|node_1}} with square and pentagonal faces: : [[File:H2 tiling 245-5.png|240px]] ==== Related honeycombs==== It is similar to the Euclidean (order-4) [[runcinated cubic honeycomb]], t0,3{4,3,4}: :[[File:Runcinated cubic honeycomb.png|240px]] {{Runcinated compact H3 honeycombs}} {{-}} === Runcitruncated order-5 cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Runctruncated order-5 cubic honeycomb
Runcicantellated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||t0,1,3{4,3,5} |- |width=120 bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node_1|4|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Truncated cube|t{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t01.png|40px]]
[[Rhombicosidodecahedron|rr{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t02.png|40px]]
[[Pentagonal prism|{}x{5}]] [[File:Pentagonal prism.png|40px]]
[[Octagonal prism|{}x{8}]] [[File:Octagonal prism.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[Square]] {4}
[[Pentagon]] {5}
[[Octagon]] {8} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Runcitruncated_order-5_cubic_honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
quad-pyramid |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''runcitruncated order-5 cubic honeycomb''' or '''runcicantellated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb''' {{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node_1|4|node_1}}, has [[cube]], [[dodecahedron]], and [[pentagonal prism]] cells, with a quad-pyramid [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3_534-1101_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] ==== Related honeycombs==== It is similar to the Euclidean (order-4) [[runcitruncated cubic honeycomb]], t0,1,3{4,3,4}: :[[File:Runcitruncated cubic honeycomb.jpg|240px]] {{Runcitruncated compact H3 honeycombs}} {{-}} === Omnitruncated order-5 cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Omnitruncated order-5 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]]
[[Semiregular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||t0,1,2,3{4,3,5} |- |width=120 bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node_1|4|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[truncated icosidodecahedron|tr{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-53-t012.png|40px]]
[[truncated cuboctahedron|tr{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform_polyhedron-43-t012.png|40px]]
[[decagonal prism|{10}x{}]] [[File:decagonal prism.png|40px]]
[[octagonal prism|{8}x{}]] [[File:octagonal prism.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Square]] {4}
[[Hexagon]] {6}
[[Octagon]] {8}
[[Decagon]] {10} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Omnitruncated_order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb_verf.png|80px]]
[[tetrahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}3, [5,3,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''omnitruncated order-5 cubic honeycomb''' or '''omnitruncated order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb''' has Coxeter diagram {{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node_1|4|node_1}}. [[File:H3 534-1111 center ultrawide.png|480px]] ==== Related honeycombs==== It is similar to the Euclidean (order-4) [[omnitruncated cubic honeycomb]], t0,1,2,3{4,3,4}: :[[File:Omnitruncated cubic honeycomb1.png|240px]] {{Omnitruncated compact H3 honeycombs}} {{-}} === Alternated order-5 cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Alternated order-5 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||h{4,3,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node|5|node}} ↔ {{CDD|nodes_10ru|split2|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Tetrahedron|{3,3}]] [[File:Tetrahedron.png|40px]]
[[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[Image:icosahedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3}
[[pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Alternated order-5 cubic honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[icosidodecahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|DH}}3, [5,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||[[Quasiregular honeycomb|quasiregular]] |} In 3-dimensional hyperbolic geometry, the '''alternated order-5 cubic honeycomb''' is a uniform compact space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] h{4,3,5}, it can be considered a [[quasiregular honeycomb]], alternating [[icosahedron|icosahedra]] and tetrahedra around each vertex in an [[icosidodecahedron]] vertex figure. [[File:Alternated order 5 cubic honeycomb.png|480px]] {{-}} ==== Related honeycombs==== It has 3 related forms: the [[cantic order-5 cubic honeycomb]], {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node_1|5|node}}, the [[runcic order-5 cubic honeycomb]], {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node|5|node_1}}, and the [[runcicantic order-5 cubic honeycomb]], {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node_1|5|node_1}}. ===Cantic order-5 cubic honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cantic order-5 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||h2{4,3,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node_1|5|node}} ↔ {{CDD|nodes_10ru|split2|node_1|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Icosidodecahedron|r{5,3}]] [[File:icosidodecahedron.png|40px]]
[[truncated icosahedron|t{3,5}]] [[Image:Truncated icosahedron.png|40px]]
[[Truncated tetrahedron|t{3,3}]] [[Image:Truncated tetrahedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[Pentagon]] {5}
[[Hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Truncated_alternated_order-5_cubic_honeycomb_verf.png|60px]]
Rectangular pyramid |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|DH}}3, [5,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''cantic order-5 cubic honeycomb''' is a uniform compact space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). It has [[Schläfli symbol]] h2{4,3,5} and a rectangular pyramid [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 5311-0110 center ultrawide.png|480px]] {{-}} ===Runcic order-5 cubic honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Runcic order-5 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||h3{4,3,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node|5|node_1}} ↔ {{CDD|nodes_10ru|split2|node|5|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[dodecahedron|{5,3}]] [[Image:dodecahedron.png|40px]]
[[rhombicosidodecahedron|rr{5,3}]] [[Image:Small rhombicosidodecahedron.png|40px]]
[[tetrahedron|{3,3}]] [[Image:tetrahedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Runcinated_alternated_order-5_cubic_honeycomb_verf.png|60px]]
triangular prism |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|DH}}3, [5,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''runcic order-5 cubic honeycomb''' is a uniform compact space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). It has [[Schläfli symbol]] h3{4,3,5} and a triangular prism [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3_5311-1010_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] {{-}} ===Runcicantic order-5 cubic honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Runcicantic order-5 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||h2,3{4,3,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node_1|5|node_1}} ↔ {{CDD|nodes_10ru|split2|node_1|5|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Truncated dodecahedron|t{5,3}]] [[Image:truncated dodecahedron.png|40px]]
[[rhombicosidodecahedron|tr{5,3}]] [[Image:Great rhombicosidodecahedron.png|40px]]
[[truncated tetrahedron|t{3,3}]] [[Image:truncated tetrahedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6}
[[dodecagon]] {10} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Image:Runcitruncated alternated order-5 cubic honeycomb verf.png|60px]]
[[mirrored sphenoid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|DH}}3, [5,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''runcicantic order-5 cubic honeycomb''' is a uniform compact space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). It has [[Schläfli symbol]] h2,3{4,3,5} and a [[mirrored sphenoid]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3_5311-1110_center_ultrawide.png|480px]] {{-}} ==See also== * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] == References == *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294-296) *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'', Dover Publications, 1999 {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10: Regular honeycombs in hyperbolic space, Summary tables II,III,IV,V, p212-213) * [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|Norman Johnson]] ''Uniform Polytopes'', Manuscript ** [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|N.W. Johnson]]: ''The Theory of Uniform Polytopes and Honeycombs'', Ph.D. Dissertation, University of Toronto, 1966 ** N.W. Johnson: ''Geometries and Transformations'', (2015) Chapter 13: Hyperbolic Coxeter groups [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

pages.title: Order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb |- |colspan=2 align=center|[[File:H3_535_CC_center.png|320px]]
[[Perspective projection]] view
from center of [[Poincaré disk model]] |-[ |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List_of_regular_polytopes#Tessellations_of_hyperbolic_3-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]]
[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space|Uniform hyperbolic honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{5,3,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[dodecahedron|{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Order-5_dodecahedral_honeycomb_verf.png|100px]]
[[regular icosahedron|icosahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Self-dual polytope|Self-dual]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|K}}3, [5,3,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} The '''order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb''' is one of four compact [[regular polytope|regular]] space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]s) in [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]]. With [[Schläfli symbol]] {5,3,5}, it has five [[regular dodecahedron|dodecahedral]] cells around each edge, and each vertex is surrounded by twenty dodecahedra. Its [[vertex figure]] is a [[regular icosahedron]]. {{Honeycomb}} == Description== The [[dihedral angle]] of a Euclidean regular dodecahedron is ~116.6°, so no more than three of them can fit around an edge in Euclidean 3-space. In hyperbolic space, however, the dihedral angle is smaller than it is in Euclidean space, and depends on the size of the figure; the smallest possible dihedral angle is 60°, for an ideal hyperbolic regular dodecahedron with infinitely long edges. The dodecahedra in this dodecahedral honeycomb are sized so that all of their dihedral angles are exactly 72°. == Images== [[File:H2 tiling 255-1.png|240px|thumb|It is analogous to the 2D hyperbolic [[order-5 pentagonal tiling]], {5,5}]] [[File:Order 5 dodecahedral honeycomb.png|320px]] == Related polytopes and honeycombs == There are four regular compact honeycombs in 3D hyperbolic space: {{Regular compact H3 honeycombs}} There is another honeycomb in hyperbolic 3-space called the [[order-4 dodecahedral honeycomb]], {5,3,4}, which has only four dodecahedra per edge. These honeycombs are also related to the [[120-cell]] which can be considered as a honeycomb in positively curved space (the surface of a 4-dimensional sphere), with three dodecahedra on each edge, {5,3,3}. Lastly the dodecahedral [[ditope]], {5,3,2} exists on a [[3-sphere]], with 2 hemispherical cells. There are [[Convex_uniform_honeycombs_in_hyperbolic_space#.5B5.2C3.2C5.5D_family|nine uniform honeycombs]] in the [5,3,5] [[Coxeter group]] family, including this regular form. Also the [[Bitruncation (geometry)|bitruncated]] form, t1,2{5,3,5}, {{CDD|node|5|node_1|3|node_1|5|node}}, of this honeycomb has all [[truncated icosahedron]] cells. {{535 family}} The [[Seifert–Weber space]] is a [[compact space|compact]] [[manifold]] that can be formed as a [[Quotient space (topology)|quotient space]] of the order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb. This honeycomb is a part of a sequence of polychora and honeycombs with [[icosahedron]] vertex figures: {{Icosahedral vertex figure tessellations}} This honeycomb is a part of a sequence of regular polytopes and honeycombs with [[dodecahedral]] cells: {{Dodecahedral_tessellations small}} {{Symmetric2_tessellations}} === Rectified order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Rectified order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||r{5,3,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node|5|node_1|3|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[icosidodecahedron|r{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t1.png|40px]]
[[icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3}
[[pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Rectified order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[pentagonal prism]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|K}}3, [5,3,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The '''rectified order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb''', {{CDD|node|5|node_1|3|node|5|node}}, has alternating [[icosahedron]] and [[icosidodecahedron]] cells, with a [[pentagonal prism]] [[vertex figure]]. : [[File:H3_535_CC_center_0100.png|480px]] ==== Related tilings and honeycomb==== [[File:H2 tiling 255-2.png|240px|thumb|It can be seen as analogous to the 2D hyperbolic [[order-4 pentagonal tiling]], r{5,5}]] There are four rectified compact regular honeycombs: {{Rectified compact H3 honeycombs}} {{Pentagonal prism vertex figure tessellations}} {{-}} === Truncated order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Truncated order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||t{5,3,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Truncated dodecahedron|r{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t01.png|40px]]
[[icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[triangle]] {3}
[[pentagon]] {5}
[[dodecagon]] {10} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Truncated order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[pentagonal pyramid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|K}}3, [5,3,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''truncated order-5 dodecahedral honeycomb''', {{CDD|node_1|5|node_1|3|node|5|node}}, has [[icosahedron]] and [[truncated dodecahedron]] cells, with a [[pentagonal pyramid]] [[vertex figure]]. pages.title: Order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |colspan=2 align=center|[[File:H3 635 FC boundary.png|300px]]
[[Perspective projection]] view
from center of [[Poincaré disk model]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]]
[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb#.5B6.2C3.2C4.5D family|Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{6,3,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|5|node}}
[[File:CDel_635_index120.png|100px]] ↔ {{CDD|node_1|6|node_g|3sg|node_g|5g|node_g}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t0.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[pentagon]] {5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[icosahedron|{3,5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6 dodecahedral honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|HV}}3, [6,3,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the field of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic geometry]], the '''order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''' arises one of 11 [[Paracompact uniform honeycombs#Regular paracompact honeycombs|regular paracompact honeycombs]] in 3-dimensional [[hyperbolic space]]. It is called '''paracompact''' because it has infinite [[Cell (geometry)|cells]]. Each cell consists of a [[hexagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[horosphere]]: a flat plane in hyperbolic space that approaches a single [[ideal point]] at infinity. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb is {6,3,5}. Since that of the [[hexagonal tiling]] of the plane is {6,3}, this honeycomb has five such hexagonal tilings meeting at each edge. Since the Schläfli symbol of the [[icosahedron]] is {3,5}, the [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is an icosahedron. Thus, 20 hexagonal tilings meet at each vertex of this honeycomb.Coxeter ''The Beauty of Geometry'', 1999, Chapter 10, Table III {{Honeycomb}} == Symmetry== A lower symmetry, [6,(3,5)*], index 120 construction exists with regular [[dodecahedral]] fundamental domains, and an icosahedral shaped Coxeter diagram with 6 axial infinite order (ultraparallel) branches. == Images== It is similar to the 2D hyperbolic regular tiling, {∞,5}, with infinite [[apeirogon]]al faces, and 5 meeting around every vertex ([[Peak (geometry)|peak]]). : [[File:H2 tiling 25i-1.png|240px]] == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It is [[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|one of 15 regular hyperbolic honeycombs]] in 3-space, 11 of which like this one are paracompact, with infinite cells or vertex figures. {{Regular_paracompact_H3_honeycombs}} There are [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space#.5B5.2C3.2C6.5D family|15 uniform honeycombs]] in the [5,3,6] [[Coxeter group]] family, including this regular form and its regular dual, order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb, {6,3,5}. {{635 family}} It has a related [[Alternation (geometry)|alternation]] honeycomb, represented by {{CDD|node_h1|6|node|3|node|5|node}} ↔ {{CDD|branch_10ru|split2|node|5|node}}, having [[icosahedron]] and [[triangular tiling]] cells. It is a part of sequence of regular honeycombs with hexagonal tiling hyperbolic honeycombs of the form {6,3,p}: {{Hexagonal tiling cell tessellations}} This honeycomb is a part of a sequence of polychora and honeycombs with [[icosahedron]] vertex figures: {{Icosahedral vertex figure tessellations}} === Rectified order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Rectified order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||r{6,3,5} or t1{6,3,5}
2r{5,3[3]} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node|6|node_1|3|node|5|node}}
{{CDD|node_h0|6|node_1|3|node|5|node}} ↔ {{CDD|branch_11|split2|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t2.png|60px]]
[[Trihexagonal tiling|r{6,3}]], r{3[3]}
[[File:Uniform tiling 63-t1.png|60px]][[File:Uniform tiling 333-t01.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[Pentagon]] {5}
[[Hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Rectified order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[Pentagonal prism]] {}×{5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{\bar{VH}}_3, [6,3,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The '''rectified order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''', t1{6,3,5}, {{CDD|node|6|node_1|3|node|5|node}} has [[icosahedron]] and [[trihexagonal tiling]] facets, with a [[pentagonal prism]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 635 boundary 0100.png|320px]] It is similar to the 2D hyperbolic [[infinite-order square tiling]], r{∞,5} with pentagon and apeirogonal faces. All vertices are on the ideal surface. : [[File:H2 tiling 25i-2.png|240px]] {{Pentagonal prism vertex figure tessellations}} {{-}} === Truncated order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Truncated order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||t{6,3,5} or t0,1{6,3,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node_1|3|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Icosahedron|{3,5}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t2.png|60px]]
[[triangular tiling|t{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t01.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[Pentagon]] {5}
[[Hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Truncated order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[Pentagonal pyramid]] {}v{5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{\bar{VH}}_3, [6,3,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''truncated order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''', t0,1{6,3,5}, {{CDD|node_1|6|node_1|3|node|5|node}} has [[icosahedron]] and [[triangular tiling]] facets, with a [[pentagonal pyramid]] [[vertex figure]]. [[rhombitrihexagonal tiling|rr{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t02.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[Pentagon]] {5}
[[Hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Cantellated order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[triangular prism]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{\bar{VH}}_3, [6,3,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''cantellated order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''', t0,2{6,3,5}, {{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node_1|5|node}} has [[icosidodecahedron]] and [[rhombitrihexagonal tiling]] facets, with a [[triangular prism]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 635-1010.png|480px]] {{-}} === Bitruncated order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Bitruncated order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||2t{6,3,5} or t1,2{6,3,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node|6|node_1|3|node_1|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells|| |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces|| |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Bitruncated order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[Tetrahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{\bar{VH}}_3, [6,3,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''bitruncated order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''', t1,2{6,3,5}, {{CDD|node|6|node_1|3|node_1|5|node}} has a [[tetrahedral]] [[vertex figure]]. pages.title: Order-5 icosahedral 120-cell honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="280"
!bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5 icosahedral 120-cell honeycomb
|-
|bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|(No image)
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List_of_regular_polytopes#Tessellations_of_hyperbolic_4-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{3,5,5/2,5} 
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|5|node|5|rat|2x|node|5|node}}
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|4-faces||[[File:Ortho solid 007-uniform polychoron 35p-t0.png|50px]] [[Icosahedral 120-cell|{3,5,5/2}]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[File:Icosahedron.png|30px]] [[Icosahedron|{3,5}]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[File:Regular_polygon_3_annotated.svg|30px]] [[Triangle|{3}]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Face figure||[[File:Regular_polygon_5_annotated.svg|30px]] [[Pentagon|{5}]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[File:Small stellated dodecahedron.png|30px]] [[Small stellated dodecahedron|{5/2,5}]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[File:Ortho solid 008-uniform polychoron 5p5-t0.png|50px]] [[Great 120-cell|{5,5/2,5}]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Great 120-cell honeycomb]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|H}}<sub>4</sub>, [5,3,3,3]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular
|}
In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 4-space]], the '''order-5 icosahedral 120-cell honeycomb''' is one of four [[regular polytope|regular]] star-[[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycombs]]. With [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,5,5/2,5}, it has five [[icosahedral 120-cell]]s around each face. It is [[dual polytope|dual]] to the [[great 120-cell honeycomb]].

It can be constructed by replacing the [[great dodecahedron|great dodecahedral]] cells of the great 120-cell honeycomb with their [[regular icosahedron|icosahedral]] convex hulls, thus replacing the [[great 120-cell]]s with [[icosahedral 120-cell]]s. It is thus analogous to the four-dimensional [[icosahedral 120-cell]]. It has [[density (polytope)|density]] 10.

== See also ==
* [[List of regular polytopes]]

== References ==
*[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296)
*[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'', Dover Publications, 1999 {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10: Regular honeycombs in hyperbolic space, Summary tables II,III,IV,V, p212-213)

{{geometry-stub}}

pages.title: Order-5 octahedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5 octahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{3,4,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Octahedron|{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-34-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-5 square tiling|{4,5}]] [[File:H2 tiling 245-4.png|50px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-4-3 pentagonal honeycomb|{5,4,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[3,4,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5 octahedral honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,4,5}. It has five [[octahedra]] {3,4} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many octahedra existing around each vertex in an [[order-5 square tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. == Images== {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-4-5 poincare cc.png|240px]]

{{CDD|node_1|3|node|4|node|6|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-44|branch}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[octahedron|{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-34-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-6 square tiling|{4,6}]] [[File:H2 tiling 246-4.png|40px]]
{(4,3,4)} [[File:Uniform tiling 443-t1.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[order-4-3 hexagonal honeycomb|{6,4,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[3,4,6]
[3,((4,3,4))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-6 octahedral honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,4,6}. It has six [[octahedra]], {3,4}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many octahedra existing around each vertex in an [[order-6 square tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-4-6 poincare cc.png|240px]]

pages.title: Order-5 tesseractic honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250"
!bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5 tesseractic honeycomb
|-
|bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|(No image)
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List_of_regular_polytopes#Tessellations_of_hyperbolic_4-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{4,3,3,5}
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|3|node|3|node|5|node}}
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|4-faces||[[File:Schlegel_wireframe_8-cell.png|50px]] [[tesseract|{4,3,3}]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[File:Hexahedron.png|30px]] [[Cube|{4,3}]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[File:Regular_polygon_4_annotated.svg|30px]] [[Square|{4}]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Face figure||[[File:Regular_polygon_5_annotated.svg|30px]] [[Pentagon|{5}]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[File:Icosahedron.svg|30px]] [[Icosahedron|{3,5}]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[File:Schlegel_wireframe_600-cell_vertex-centered.png|50px]] [[600-cell|{3,3,5}]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-4 120-cell honeycomb]]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BH}}<sub>4</sub>, [5,3,3,4]
|-
|bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular
|}
In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 4-space]], the '''order-5 tesseractic honeycomb''' is one of five compact [[regular polytope|regular]] space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycombs]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,3,3,5}, it has five [[8-cell]]s (also known as tesseracts) around each face. Its [[dual polytope|dual]] is the [[order-4 120-cell honeycomb]], {5,3,3,4}.

== Related polytopes and honeycombs==
It is related to the Euclidean 4-space (order-4) [[tesseractic honeycomb]], {4,3,3,4}, and the [[5-cube]], {4,3,3,3} in Euclidean 5-space. The ''5-cube'' can also be seen as an ''order-3 tesseractic honeycomb'' on the surface of a [[4-sphere]].

It is analogous to the [[order-5 cubic honeycomb]] {4,3,5} and [[order-5 square tiling]] {4,5}.

== See also ==
* [[List of regular polytopes]]

== References ==
*[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296)
*[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'', Dover Publications, 1999 {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10: Regular honeycombs in hyperbolic space, Summary tables II,III,IV,V, p212-213)

[[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]
