{{CDD|node_1|ultra|node|split1|branch|uaub|nodes_11}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|4|node_g|3sg|node_g|6|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Cell (geometry)|Cells]]||[[cube|{4,3}]] [[File:Hexahedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Face (geometry)|Faces]]||[[square (geometry)|square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure#Edge figure|Edge figure]]||[[pentagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[triangular tiling]] {3,6}
[[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.png|80px]] [[File:Uniform tiling 333-t1.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|BV}}3, [6,3,4]
{{overline|BP}}3, [4,3[3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular, [[Quasiregular honeycomb|quasiregular]] |} The '''order-6 cubic honeycomb''' is a paracompact [[regular polytope|regular]] space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]s) in [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]]. It is called ''paracompact'' because it has infinite [[vertex figure]]s, with all vertices as [[ideal point]]s at infinity. With [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,3,6}, it has six cubes meeting along each edge. Its [[vertex figure]] is an infinite [[triangular tiling]]. It is [[Dual polytope|dual]] is the [[order-4 hexagonal tiling honeycomb]]. {{Honeycomb}} == Images == {| class=wikitable width=480 |- valign=top |[[File:Order-6_cubic_honeycomb_cell.png|240px]]
One cell viewed outside of Poincare sphere model | [[File:H2 tiling 24i-4.png|240px]]
It is similar to the 2D hyperbolic [[infinite-order square tiling]], {4,∞} with square faces. All vertices are on the ideal surface. |} == Symmetry == A half symmetry construction exists as {4,3[3]}, with alternating two types (colors) of cubic cells. {{CDD|node_1|4|node|3|node|6|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|4|node|split1|branch}}. Another lower symmetry, [4,3*,6], index 6 exists with a nonsimplex fundamental domain, {{CDD|node_1|ultra|node|split1|branch|uaub|nodes_11}}. This honeycomb contains {{CDD|node|3|node|ultra|node_1}} that tile 2-[[hypercycle (geometry)|hypercycle]] surfaces, similar to this paracompact tiling, {{CDD|node|3|node|infin|node_1}}: : [[File:H2 tiling 23i-1.png|120px]] == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It is [[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|one of 15 regular hyperbolic honeycombs]] in 3-space, 11 of which like this one are paracompact, with infinite cells or vertex figures. {{Regular_paracompact_H3_honeycombs}} It is related to the regular (order-4) [[cubic honeycomb]] of Euclidean 3-space, [[order-5 cubic honeycomb]] in hyperbolic space, which have 4 and 5 cubes per edge respectively. It has a related [[Alternation (geometry)|alternation]] honeycomb, represented by {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node|6|node}} ↔ {{CDD|nodes_10ru|split2|node|6|node}}, having [[hexagonal tiling]] and [[tetrahedron]] cells. There are [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space#.5B5.2C3.2C4.5D family|fifteen uniform honeycombs]] in the [6,3,4] [[Coxeter group]] family, including this regular form. {{634 family}} It in a sequence of [[regular polychora]] and honeycombs with [[cube|cubic]] [[cell (geometry)|cells]]. {{Cubic cell tessellations}} It is a part of a sequence of honeycombs with [[triangular tiling]] [[vertex figures]]. {{Triangular tiling vertex figure tessellations small}} === Rectified order-6 cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Rectified order-6 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||r{4,3,6} or t1{4,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node|4|node_1|3|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|nodes_11|split2|node|6|node}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h0|4|node_1|3|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node|4|node_1|split1|branch}} ↔ {{CDD|node|4|node_1|3|node|6|node_h0}}
{{CDD|node_1|split1|branch|split2|node_1}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h0|4|node_1|3|node|6|node_h0}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Cuboctahedron|r{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-43-t1.png|60px]]
[[Triangular tiling|{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[Square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Rectified order-6 cubic honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[hexagonal prism]] {}×{6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{{overline|BV}}3, [6,3,4]
{{overline|DV}}3, [6,31,1]
[4,3[3]]
[3[ ]×[3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The '''rectified order-6 cubic honeycomb''', r{4,3,6}, {{CDD||node|4|node_1|3|node|6|node}} has [[Cuboctahedron|cuboctahedral]] and [[triangular tiling]] facets, with a [[hexagonal prism]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 436 CC center 0100.png|320px]] It is similar to the 2D hyperbolic [[tetraapeirogonal tiling]], r{4,∞}, {{CDD||node|4|node_1|infin|node}} alternating apeirogonal and square faces: : [[File:H2 tiling 24i-2.png|240px]] {{Hexagonal tiling vertex figure tessellations}} {{-}} === Truncated order-6 cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Truncated order-6 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||t{4,3,6} or t0,1{4,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|4|node_1|3|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node_1|split1|branch}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|4|node_1|3|node|6|node_h0}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[truncated cube|t{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-43-t01.png|60px]]
[[Triangular tiling|{3,6}]][[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[octagon]] {8} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Truncated order-6 cubic honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[hexagonal pyramid]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{{overline|BV}}3, [6,3,4]
[4,3[3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''truncated order-6 cubic honeycomb''', t{4,3,6}, {{CDD||node_1|4|node_1|3|node|6|node}} has [[truncated octahedron]] and [[triangular tiling]] facets, with a [[hexagonal pyramid]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 634-0011.png|480px]] It is similar to the 2D hyperbolic [[truncated infinite-order square tiling]], t{4,∞}, {{CDD||node_1|4|node_1|infin|node}} with apeirogonal and octagonal (truncated square) faces: : [[File:H2 tiling 24i-6.png|240px]] {{-}} === Cantellated order-6 cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cantellated order-6 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||rr{4,3,6} or t0,2{4,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|3|node_1|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node|split1|branch_11}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|4|node|3|node_1|6|node_h0}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[truncated cube|rr{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-43-t02.png|60px]]
[[Trihexagonal tiling|r{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t1.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[square]] {4}
[[hexagon]] {6}
[[octagon]] {8} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Cantellated order-6 cubic honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[triangular prism]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{{overline|BV}}3, [6,3,4]
[4,3[3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''cantellated order-6 cubic honeycomb''', rr{4,3,6}, {{CDD||node_1|4|node|3|node_1|6|node}} has [[rhombicuboctahedron]] and [[trihexagonal tiling]] facets, with a [[triangular prism]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 634-0101.png|480px]] {{-}} === Alternated order-6 cubic honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Alternated order-6 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]]
[[Semiregular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||h{4,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node|6|node}} ↔ {{CDD|nodes_10ru|split2|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_h1|4|node|split1|branch}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node|6|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|split1|branch|split2|node}}
{{CDD|node_h|ultra|node|split1|branch|uaub|nodes_hh}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h|4|node_g|3sg|node_g|6|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Tetrahedron|{3,3}]] [[File:Tetrahedron.png|40px]]
[[triangular tiling|{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Uniform tiling 63-t1.png|40px]]
[[trihexagonal tiling]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|DV}}3, [6,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive, [[quasiregular honeycomb|quasiregular]] |} In 3-dimensional hyperbolic geometry, the '''alternated order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''' is a uniform compact space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycombs]]). As an [[alternation (geometry)|alternated]] order-6 cubic honeycomb and [[Schläfli symbol]] h{4,3,6}, with [[Coxeter diagram]] {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node|6|node}} or {{CDD|nodes_10ru|split2|node|6|node}}. It can be considered a [[quasiregular honeycomb]], alternating [[triangular tiling]] and [[tetrahedron]] around each vertex in a [[trihexagonal tiling]] vertex figure. ==== Symmetry ==== A half symmetry construction exists from {4,3[3]}, with alternating two types (colors) of cubic cells. {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node|6|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|split1|branch}}. Another lower symmetry, [4,3*,6], index 6 exists with a nonsimplex fundamental domain, {{CDD|node_h|ultra|node|split1|branch|uaub|nodes_hh}}. ==== Related honeycombs==== {{Quasiregular polychora and honeycombs}} It has 3 related form [[cantic order-6 cubic honeycomb]], h2{4,3,6}, {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node_1|6|node}}, [[runcic order-6 cubic honeycomb]], h3{4,3,6}, {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node|6|node_1}}, [[runcicantic order-6 cubic honeycomb]], h2,3{4,3,6}, {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node_1|6|node_1}}. {{-}} ===Cantic order-6 cubic honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cantic order-6 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||h2{4,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node_1|6|node}} ↔ {{CDD|nodes_10ru|split2|node_1|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node_1|6|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h1|4|node|split1|branch_11}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|split1|branch_11|split2|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Truncated tetrahedron|t{3,3}]] [[File:Truncated tetrahedron.png|40px]]
[[trihexagonal tiling|r{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t1.png|40px]]
[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t01.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure|| |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|DV}}3, [6,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''cantic order-6 cubic honeycomb''' is a uniform compact space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycombs]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] h2{4,3,6}. {{-}} ===Runcic order-6 cubic honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Runcic order-6 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||h3{4,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node|6|node_1}} ↔ {{CDD|nodes_10ru|split2|node|6|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[tetrahedron|{3,3}]] [[Image:tetrahedron.png|40px]]
[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t0.png|40px]]
[[rhombitrihexagonal tiling|rr{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t02.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||triangular prism |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|DV}}3, [6,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''runcic order-6 cubic honeycomb''' is a uniform compact space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycombs]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] h3{4,3,6}, with a triangular prism [[vertex figure]]. {{-}} ===Runcicantic order-6 cubic honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="250" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Runcicantic order-6 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||h2,3{4,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_h1|4|node|3|node_1|6|node_1}} ↔ {{CDD|nodes_10ru|split2|node_1|6|node_1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t0.png|40px]]
[[truncated trihexagonal tiling|tr{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t012.svg|40px]]
[[tetrahedron|{3,3}]] [[Image:tetrahedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[square]] {4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||tetrahedron |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|DV}}3, [6,31,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''runcicantic order-6 cubic honeycomb''' is a uniform compact space-filling [[tessellation]]s (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycombs]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] h2,3{4,3,6}, with a tetrahedral [[vertex figure]]. {{-}} ==See also== * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] == References == *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{isbn|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapter 16-17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|Norman Johnson]] ''Uniform Polytopes'', Manuscript ** [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|N.W. Johnson]]: ''The Theory of Uniform Polytopes and Honeycombs'', Ph.D. Dissertation, University of Toronto, 1966 ** N.W. Johnson: ''Geometries and Transformations'', (2018) Chapter 13: Hyperbolic Coxeter groups [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

{{overline|HP}}3, [5,3[3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular, [[Quasiregular honeycomb|quasiregular]] |} The '''order-6 dodecahedral honeycomb''' is one of 11 paracompact regular [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]s in [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]]. It is called ''paracompact'' because it has infinite [[vertex figure]]s, with all vertices as [[ideal point]]s at infinity. It has [[Schläfli symbol]] {5,3,6}, being composed of [[dodecahedron|dodecahedral]] cells, each edge of the honeycomb is surrounded by six dodecahedra. Each vertex is ideal and surrounded by infinitely many dodecahedra with a [[vertex figure]] as a [[triangular tiling]]. {{Honeycomb}} == Symmetry== A half symmetry construction exists as {{CDD|node_1|5|node|split1|branch}} with alternately colored dodecahedral cells. == Images == {| class=wikitable width=320 |[[File:Order-6 dodecahedral honeycomb.png|320px]]
The model is cell-centered in the within [[Poincaré disk model]], with the viewpoint then placed at the origin. |} It is similar to the 2D hyperbolic [[infinite-order pentagonal tiling]], {5,∞} with pentagonal faces. All vertices are on the ideal surface. : [[File:H2 tiling 25i-4.png|240px]] == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It is [[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|one of 15 regular hyperbolic honeycombs]] in 3-space, 11 of which like this one are paracompact, with infinite cells or vertex figures. {{Regular_paracompact_H3_honeycombs}} There are [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space#.5B5.2C3.2C6.5D family|15 uniform honeycombs]] in the [5,3,6] [[Coxeter group]] family, including this regular form and its regular dual, [[order-5 hexagonal tiling honeycomb]], {6,3,5}. {{635 family}} This honeycomb is a part of a sequence of polychora and honeycombs with [[triangular tiling]] vertex figures: {{Triangular tiling vertex figure tessellations small}} This honeycomb is a part of a sequence of regular polytopes and honeycombs with [[dodecahedral]] cells: {{Dodecahedral_tessellations_small}} === Rectified order-6 dodecahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Rectified order-6 dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||r{5,3,6}

pages.title: Order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |colspan=2 align=center|[[File:H3 636 FC boundary.png|320px]]
[[Perspective projection]] view
from center of [[Poincaré disk model]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]]
[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb#.5B6.2C3.2C6.5D family|Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{6,3,6}
{6,3[3]} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1|branch}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|6|node_h0}}
{{CDD|node_1|splitplit1u|branch4u_11|uabc|branch4u|splitplit2u|node}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|6|node_g|3sg|node_g|6|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t0.svg|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[triangular tiling|{3,6}]] or {3[3]}
[[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.svg|40px]] [[File:Uniform tiling 333-t1.svg|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Self-dual polytope|Self-dual]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter group]]||{{overline|Z}}3, [6,3,6]
{{overline|VP}}3, [6,3[3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular, [[Quasiregular honeycomb|quasiregular]] |} In the field of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic geometry]], the '''order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''' arises one of 11 [[Paracompact uniform honeycombs#Regular paracompact honeycombs|regular paracompact honeycombs]] in 3-dimensional [[hyperbolic space]]. It is called '''paracompact''' because it has infinite [[Cell (geometry)|cells]]. Each cell consists of a [[hexagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[horosphere]]: a flat plane in hyperbolic space that approaches a single [[ideal point]] at infinity. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the hexagonal tiling honeycomb is {6,3,6}. Since that of the [[hexagonal tiling]] of the plane is {6,3}, this honeycomb has six such hexagonal tilings meeting at each edge. Since the Schläfli symbol of the [[triangular tiling]] is {3,6}, the [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a triangular tiling. Thus, infinitely many hexagonal tilings meet at each vertex of this honeycomb.Coxeter ''The Beauty of Geometry'', 1999, Chapter 10, Table III {{Honeycomb}} == Images== It is analogous to the 2D hyperbolic [[infinite-order apeirogonal tiling]], {∞,∞} with infinite [[apeirogon]]al faces and with all vertices are on the ideal surface. : [[File:H2 tiling 2ii-4.png|240px]] This honeycomb contains {{CDD|node_1|3|node_1|ultra|node}}, {{CDD|node|3|node|ultra|node_1}} that tile 2-[[hypercycle (geometry)|hypercycle]] surfaces, similar to the paracompact tilings, {{CDD|node_1|3|node_1|infin|node}}, {{CDD|node|3|node|infin|node_1}}: : [[File:H2 tiling 23i-6.png|120px]] [[File:H2 tiling 23i-1.png|120px]] == Symmetry == [[File:Hyperbolic subgroup tree 636.png|120px|thumb|left|Subgroup relations:
{{CDD|node_c1|6|node_c2|3|node_c3|6|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_c1|6|node_c2|split1|branch_c3}}]] This honeycomb has a half symmetry construction is {{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1|branch}}, which looks identical by cells and needs faces colored by their symmetry position to be distinct. Another lower symmetry, [6,3*,6], index 6 exists with a nonsimplex fundamental domain. It has an octahedral Coxeter diagram with 6 order-3 branches, and 3 infinite-order branches in the shape of a triangular prism, {{CDD|node_1|splitplit1u|branch4u_11|uabc|branch4u|splitplit2u|node}}. {{-}} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It is [[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|one of 15 regular hyperbolic honeycombs]] in 3-space, 11 of which like this one are paracompact, with infinite cells or vertex figures. {{Regular_paracompact_H3_honeycombs}} There are [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space#.5B6.2C3.2C6.5D family|nine uniform honeycombs]] in the [6,3,6] [[Coxeter group]] family, including this regular form. {{636 family}} It has a related [[Alternation (geometry)|alternation]] honeycomb, represented by {{CDD|node_h1|6|node|3|node|6|node}} ↔ {{CDD|branch_10ru|split2|node|6|node}}, having alternating [[triangular tiling]] cells, and a regular form as {{CDD|node_1|3|node|6|node|3|node}}, called a [[triangular tiling honeycomb]]. This honeycomb is a part of a sequence of polychora and honeycombs with [[triangular tiling]] vertex figures: {{Triangular tiling vertex figure tessellations small}} {{Hexagonal tiling cell tessellations}} {{Symmetric2_tessellations}} === Rectified order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Rectified order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||r{6,3,6} or t1{6,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node|6|node_1|3|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|branch_11|split2|node|6|node}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h0|6|node_1|3|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node|6|node_1|split1|branch}} ↔ {{CDD|node|6|node_1|3|node|6|node_h0}}
{{CDD|branch_11|splitcross|branch}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h0|6|node_1|3|node|6|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_h1|6|node|3|node|6|node_h1}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Triangular tiling|{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.svg|40px]]
[[Trihexagonal tiling|r{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t1.svg|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3}
[[Hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Rectified order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb verf.png|80px]]
[[Hexagonal prism]] {}×{6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{{overline|Z}}3, [6,3,6]

[3[3,3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The ''rectified order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb'', t1{6,3,6}, {{CDD|node|6|node_1|3|node|6|node}} has [[tetrahedron|tetrahedral]] and [[trihexagonal tiling]] facets, with a [[hexagonal prism]] [[vertex figure]]. it can also be seen as a '''quarter order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb''', q{6,3,6}, {{CDD|node_h1|6|node|3|node|6|node_h1}} or {{CDD|branch_11|splitcross|branch}}. [[File:H3 636 boundary 0100.png|320px]] It is analogous to 2D hyperbolic [[order-4 apeirogonal tiling]], r{∞,∞} with infinite [[apeirogon]]al faces and with all vertices are on the ideal surface. : [[File:H2 tiling 2ii-2.png|240px]] ==== Related honeycombs==== {{Hexagonal tiling vertex figure tessellations}} The order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb is related to a matrix of 3-dimensional honeycombs: q{2p,4,2q} {{Quarter hyperbolic honeycomb table}} {{-}} === Truncated order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Truncated order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||t{6,3,6} or t0,1{6,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node_1|3|node|6|node}}

{{overline|DV}}3, [6,3[3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The ''truncated order-6 hexagonal tiling honeycomb'', t0,1{6,3,6}, {{CDD|node_1|6|node_1|3|node|6|node}} has [[triangular tiling]] and [[truncated hexagonal tiling]] facets, with a [[tetrahedral]] [[vertex figure]]. pages.title: Order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#ffffff align=center colspan=2|[[File:H3 336 CC center.png|320px]]
[[Perspective projection]] view
within [[Poincaré disk model]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Hyperbolic regular honeycomb]]
[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{3,3,6}
{3,3[3]} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|3|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|3|node|3|node|6|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1|branch}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Tetrahedron|{3,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-33-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle]] {3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Hexagon]] {6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Triangular tiling]] {3,6}
[[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.png|80px]] [[File:Uniform tiling 333-t1.png|80px]]
{{CDD|node_1|3|node|6|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Hexagonal tiling honeycomb]], {6,3,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{\bar{V}}_3, [6,3,3]
{\bar{P}}_3, [3,3[3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular, [[Quasiregular honeycomb|quasiregular]] |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb''' is a [[Paracompact space|paracompact]] regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). It is called ''paracompact'' because it has infinite [[vertex figures]], with all vertices as [[ideal point]]s at infinity. With [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,3,6}. It has six [[tetrahedra]] {3,3} around each edge. All vertices are [[ideal vertex|ideal vertices]] with infinitely many tetrahedra existing around each ideal vertex in a [[triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]].Coxeter ''The Beauty of Geometry'', 1999, Chapter 10, Table III {{Honeycomb}} == Symmetry constructions == [[File:Hyperbolic subgroup tree 336-direct.png|200px|thumb|left|[[Coxeter diagram#Subgroup relations of paracompact hyperbolic groups|Subgroup relations]]]] It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,3[3]}, with alternating types or colors of tetrahedral cells. In [[Coxeter notation]] the half symmetry is [3,3,6,1+] ↔ [3,((3,3,3))] or [3,3[3]]: {{CDD|node_c1|3|node_c2|3|node_c3|6|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_c1|3|node_c2|split1|branch_c3}}. {{-}} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It is similar to the 2-dimensional hyperbolic tiling, [[infinite-order triangular tiling]], {3,∞}, having all triangle faces, and all ideal vertices. :[[File:Infinite-order triangular tiling.svg|120px]] === Related regular honeycombs=== It is [[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|one of 15 regular hyperbolic honeycombs]] in 3-space, 11 of which like this one are paracompact, with infinite cells and/or infinite vertex figures. {{Regular_paracompact_H3_honeycombs}} === 633 honeycombs=== It is [[Paracompact uniform honeycomb#.5B6.2C3.2C3.5D family|one of 15 uniform paracompact honeycombs]] in the [6,3,3] Coxeter group, along with its dual [[hexagonal tiling honeycomb]], {6,3,3}. {{633 family}} === Tetrahedral cell honeycombs=== It a part of a sequence of [[regular polychora]] and honeycombs with [[tetrahedron|tetrahedral]] [[cell (geometry)|cells]]. {{Tetrahedral cell tessellations}} === Triangular tiling vertex figures=== It a part of a sequence of honeycombs with [[triangular tiling]] [[vertex figure]]s. {{Triangular tiling vertex figure tessellations}} === Rectified order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Rectified order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]]
[[Semiregular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||r{3,3,6} or t1{3,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node|3|node_1|3|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node|3|node_1|3|node|6|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node|3|node_1|split1|branch}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Octahedron|{3,4}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-33-t1.png|40px]]
[[Triangular tiling|{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Rectified order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb verf.png|100px]]
[[Hexagonal prism]] { }×{6}
{{CDD|node_1|2|node_1|6|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{\bar{V}}_3, [6,3,3]
{\bar{P}}_3, [3,3[3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive, edge-transitive |} The '''rectified order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb''', t1{3,3,6} has [[octahedral]] and [[triangular tiling]] cells connected in a [[hexagonal prism]] [[vertex figure]]. : [[File:H3 336 CC center 0100.png|240px]][[File:Hyperbolic rectified order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb.png|180px]]
[[Perspective projection]] view within [[Poincaré disk model]] {{Hexagonal tiling vertex figure tessellations}} {{-}} === Truncated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Truncated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||t{3,3,6} or t0,1{3,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|3|node_1|3|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|3|node_1|3|node|6|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|3|node_1|split1|branch}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Truncated tetrahedron|t{3,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-33-t01.png|40px]]
[[Triangular tiling|{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Truncated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb verf.png|100px]]
[[Hexagonal pyramid]] { }v{6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{\bar{V}}_3, [6,3,3]
{\bar{P}}_3, [3,3[3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''truncated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb''', t0,1{3,3,6} has [[truncated tetrahedron|truncated tetrahedra]] and [[triangular tiling]] cells connected in a [[hexagonal prism]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 633-0011.png|480px]] {{-}} === Bitruncated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb === {{See|Bitruncated hexagonal tiling honeycomb}} [[File:H3 633-0110.png|480px]] === Cantellated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="340" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cantellated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||rr{3,3,6} or t0,2{3,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|3|node_1|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|3|node|3|node_1|6|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1|branch_11}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[cuboctahedron|r{3,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-33-t02.png|40px]]
[[Trihexagonal tiling|r{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t1.png|40px]]
[[hexagonal prism|{}x{6}]] [[File:hexagonal prism.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Cantellated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb verf.png|100px]]
[[tetrahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{\bar{V}}_3, [6,3,3]
{\bar{P}}_3, [3,3[3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''cantellated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb''', t0,2{3,3,6} has [[cuboctahedron]] and [[trihexagonal tiling]] cells connected in a [[tetrahedron]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 633-0101.png|480px]] {{-}} === Cantitruncated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width="320" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Cantitruncated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[Paracompact uniform honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||tr{3,3,6} or t0,1,2{3,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|3|node_1|3|node_1|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|3|node_1|3|node_1|6|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|3|node_1|split1|branch_11}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[truncated cuboctahedron|tr{3,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-33-t012.png|40px]]
[[Trihexagonal tiling|r{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t1.png|40px]]
[[hexagonal prism|{}x{6}]] [[File:hexagonal prism.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:Cantitruncated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb verf.png|100px]]
[[tetrahedron]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter groups]]||{\bar{V}}_3, [6,3,3]
{\bar{P}}_3, [3,3[3]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Vertex-transitive |} The '''cantitruncated order-6 tetrahedral honeycomb''', t0,1,2{3,3,6} has [[truncated cuboctahedron]] and [[trihexagonal tiling]] cells connected in an [[octahedron]] [[vertex figure]]. [[File:H3 633-0111.png|480px]] {{-}} == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H.S.M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{isbn|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{isbn|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapter 16-17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|Norman Johnson]] ''Uniform Polytopes'', Manuscript ** [[Norman Johnson (mathematician)|N.W. pages.title: Order-6 triangular hosohedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-6 triangular hosohedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Degenerate_tessellations_of_Euclidean_3-space|Degenerate regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{2,3,6} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|2|node|3|node|6|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Hosohedron|{2,3}]] [[File:Spherical trigonal hosohedron.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[digon|{2}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[square|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Triangular tiling|{3,6}]]
[[File:Uniform_tiling_63-t2.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-2 hexagonal tiling honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram|Coxeter group]]||[2,3,6] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In [[geometry]], the '''order-6 triangular hosohedral honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {2,3,6}. It has 6 triangular [[hosohedron|hosohedra]] {2,3} around each edge. It is a degenerate honeycomb in Euclidean space, but can be seen as a projection onto the sphere. Its vertex figure, a [[triangular tiling]] is seen on each hemisphere. ==Images== [[Stereographic projection]]s of central spherical projection, with all edges being projected into circles. Seen below triangular tiling edges are colored into 3 parallel sets for each hemisphere. {| class=wikitable |- align=center |[[File:Order-6 triangular hosohedral honeycomb.png|400px]]
Centered on pole |- align=center |[[File:Order-6 triangular hosohedral honeycomb2.png|400px]]
Centered on equator |} == Related honeycombs == This honeycomb can be truncated as t{2,3,6} or {}×{3,6}, Coxeter diagram {{CDD|node_1|2|node_1|3|node|6|node}}, seen as one layer of [[triangular prism]]s, within a [[triangular prismatic honeycomb]], {{CDD|node_1|infin|node|2|node_1|3|node|6|node}}. : [[File:Triangular prismatic honeycomb.png|200px]] == See also == * [[Order-7 tetrahedral_honeycomb]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == {{reflist}} * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{isbn|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

pages.title: Order-6-4 triangular honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-6-4 triangular honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{3,6,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|6|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|3|node|6|node|4|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-66|nodes}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[triangular tiling|{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-4 hexagonal tiling|{6,4}]] [[File:H2 tiling 246-1.png|50px]]
r{6,6} [[File:H2_tiling_266-2.png|50px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6-3 square honeycomb|{4,6,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[3,6,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-6-4 triangular honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,6,4}. == Geometry== It has four [[triangular tiling]] {3,6} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many triangular tilings existing around each vertex in an [[order-4 hexagonal tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-6-4 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_364_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,61,1}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-66|nodes}}, with alternating types or colors of triangular tiling cells. In [[Coxeter notation]] the half symmetry is [3,6,4,1+] = [3,61,1]. == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It a part of a sequence of [[regular polychora]] and honeycombs with [[triangular tiling|triangular tiling]] [[cell (geometry)|cells]]: {3,6,''p''} {{triangular tiling tessellations}} {{-}} === Order-6-5 triangular honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=280 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-6-5 triangular honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{3,6,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|6|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[triangular tiling|{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[hexagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-5 hexagonal tiling|{6,5}]] [[File:H2 tiling 256-1.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6-3 pentagonal honeycomb|{5,6,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[3,6,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-6-3 triangular honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,6,5}. It has five [[triangular tiling]], {3,6}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many triangular tilings existing around each vertex in an [[order-5 hexagonal tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-6-5 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_365_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} {{-}} ===Order-6-6 triangular honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-6-6 triangular honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{3,6,6}
{3,(6,3,6)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|6|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|3|node|6|node|6|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-66|branch}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[triangular tiling|{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-6 hexagonal tiling|{6,6}]] [[File:H2 tiling 266-4.png|40px]]
{(6,3,6)} [[File:H2 tiling 366-1.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6-3 hexagonal honeycomb|{6,6,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[3,6,6]
[3,((6,3,6))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-6-6 triangular honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,6,6}. It has infinitely many [[triangular tiling]], {3,6}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many triangular tilings existing around each vertex in an [[order-6 triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-6-6 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_366_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,(6,3,6)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|3|node|6|node|6|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-66|branch}}, with alternating types or colors of triangular tiling cells. In Coxeter notation the half symmetry is [3,6,6,1+] = [3,((6,3,6))]. {{-}} ===Order-6-infinite triangular honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-6-infinite triangular honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{3,6,∞}
{3,(6,∞,6)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|3|node|6|node|infin|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|3|node|6|node|infin|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-66|branch|labelinfin}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[triangular tiling|{3,6}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Triangle|{3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Apeirogon|{∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Infinite-order hexagonal tiling|{6,∞}]] [[File:H2 tiling 26i-4.png|40px]]
{(6,∞,6)} [[File:H2 tiling 66i-4.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6-3 apeirogonal honeycomb|{∞,6,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[∞,6,3]
[3,((6,∞,6))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-6-infinite triangular honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,6,∞}. It has infinitely many [[triangular tiling]], {3,6}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many triangular tilings existing around each vertex in an [[infinite-order triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-6-i poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_36i_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {3,(6,∞,6)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|3|node|6|node|infin|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|3|node|split1-66|branch|labelinfin}}, with alternating types or colors of triangular tiling cells. In Coxeter notation the half symmetry is [3,6,∞,1+] = [3,((6,∞,6))]. == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H. S. M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{ISBN|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{ISBN|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapters 16–17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * George Maxwell, ''Sphere Packings and Hyperbolic Reflection Groups'', JOURNAL OF ALGEBRA 79,78-97 (1982) [http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0021869382903180] * Hao Chen, Jean-Philippe Labbé, ''Lorentzian Coxeter groups and Boyd-Maxwell ball packings'', (2013)[https://arxiv.org/abs/1310.8608] * [https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.02851 Visualizing Hyperbolic Honeycombs arXiv:1511.02851] Roice Nelson, Henry Segerman (2015) ==External links== * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wjeeMlHsYjE& Spherical Video: {3,6,∞} honeycomb with parabolic Möbius transform] [[YouTube]], Roice Nelson *[[John Baez]], ''Visual insights'': [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/01/733-honeycomb/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb] (2014/08/01) [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/14/733-honeycomb-meets-plane-at-infinity/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb Meets Plane at Infinity] (2014/08/14) * [[Danny Calegari]], [http://lamington.wordpress.com/2014/03/04/kleinian-a-tool-for-visualizing-kleinian-groups/Kleinian Kleinian, a tool for visualizing Kleinian groups, Geometry and the Imagination] 4 March 2014. [http://math.uchicago.edu/~dannyc/papers/kleinian_mtf_Feb_2014.pdf] [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]]

pages.title: Order-7 cubic honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=320 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-7 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{4,3,7} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|3|node|7|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[cube|{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-43-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Pentagon|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Heptagon|{7}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Infinite-order triangular tiling|{3,7}]]
[[File:Order-7 triangular tiling.svg|61px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-4 heptagonal tiling honeycomb|{7,3,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[4,3,7] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-7 cubic honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,3,7}, it has infinitely many [[cubes]] {4,3} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many cubes existing around each vertex in an [[order-7 triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. == Images== {| class=wikitable width=400 |+ [[Poincaré disk model]] |- align=center |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-3-7 poincare cc.png|200px]]
Cell-centered |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-3-7 poincare.png|200px]] |- align=center |[[File:Order-7_cubic_honeycomb_cell.png|200px]]
One cell at center |[[File:Order-7_cubic_honeycomb_cell2.png|200px]]
One cell with ideal surface |} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It is one of a series of regular polytopes and honeycombs with cubic cells: {4,3,''p''}: {{Cubic tessellations small}} It is a part of a sequence of hyperbolic honeycombs with [[order-7 triangular tiling]] [[vertex figure]]s, {''p'',3,7}. {| class=wikitable ![[Order-7 tetrahedral honeycomb|{3,3,7}]] !{4,3,7} ![[Order-7 dodecahedral honeycomb|{5,3,7}]] ![[Order-3-7 hexagonal honeycomb|{6,3,7}]] ![[Order-3-7 heptagonal honeycomb|{7,3,7}]] ![[Order-3-7 octagonal honeycomb|{8,3,7}]] ![[Order-3-7 aperiogonal honeycomb|{∞,3,7}]] |- |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-3-7 poincare cc.png|80px]] |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-3-7 poincare cc.png|80px]] |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 5-3-7 poincare cc.png|80px]] |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 6-3-7 poincare.png|80px]] |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 7-3-7 poincare.png|80px]] |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 8-3-7 poincare.png|80px]] |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb i-3-7 poincare.png|80px]] |} {{-}} === Order-8 cubic honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=320 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-8 cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{4,3,8}
{4,(3,8,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|3|node|8|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node|3|node|8|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|4|node|split1|branch|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[cube|{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-43-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Pentagon|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Octagon|{8}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Infinite-order triangular tiling|{3,8}]], {(3,4,3)}
[[File:H2 tiling 238-4.png|60px]][[File:H2 tiling 334-4.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-4 octagonal tiling honeycomb|{8,3,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[4,3,8]
[4,((3,4,3))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-8 cubic honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,3,8}. It has infinitely many [[cubes]] {4,3} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many cubes existing around each vertex in an [[order-8 triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-3-8 poincare cc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
Cell-centered |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-3-8 poincare.png|240px]]
Poincaré disk model |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,(3,4,3)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|4|node|split1|branch|label4}}, with alternating types or colors of cubic cells. {{-}} === Infinite-order cubic honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=320 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Infinite-order cubic honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{4,3,∞}
{4,(3,∞,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|3|node|infin|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node|3|node|infin|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|4|node|split1|branch|labelinfin}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[cube|{4,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-43-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Pentagon|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Apeirogon|{∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Infinite-order triangular tiling|{3,∞}]], {(3,∞,3)}
[[File:H2 tiling 23i-4.png|60px]][[File:H2 tiling 33i-4.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-4 apeirogonal tiling honeycomb|{∞,3,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[4,3,∞]
[4,((3,∞,3))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''infinite-order cubic honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,3,∞}. It has infinitely many [[cubes]] {4,3} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many cubes existing around each vertex in an [[infinite-order triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-3-i poincare cc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
Cell-centered |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-3-i poincare.png|240px]]
Poincaré disk model |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,(3,∞,3)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|4|node|split1|branch|labelinfin}}, with alternating types or colors of cubic cells. == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] * [[Infinite-order hexagonal tiling honeycomb]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H. S. M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{ISBN|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{ISBN|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapters 16–17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * George Maxwell, ''Sphere Packings and Hyperbolic Reflection Groups'', JOURNAL OF ALGEBRA 79,78-97 (1982) [http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0021869382903180] * Hao Chen, Jean-Philippe Labbé, ''Lorentzian Coxeter groups and Boyd-Maxwell ball packings'', (2013)[https://arxiv.org/abs/1310.8608] * [https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.02851 Visualizing Hyperbolic Honeycombs arXiv:1511.02851] Roice Nelson, Henry Segerman (2015) == External links == *[[John Baez]], ''Visual insights'': [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/01/733-honeycomb/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb] (2014/08/01) [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/14/733-honeycomb-meets-plane-at-infinity/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb Meets Plane at Infinity] (2014/08/14) [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]] * [[Danny Calegari]], [http://lamington.wordpress.com/2014/03/04/kleinian-a-tool-for-visualizing-kleinian-groups/Kleinian Kleinian, a tool for visualizing Kleinian groups, Geometry and the Imagination] 4 March 2014. pages.title: Order-7 dodecahedral honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=320 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-7 dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{5,3,7} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|7|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[dodecahedron|{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Heptagon|{7}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-7 triangular tiling|{3,7}]]
[[File:Order-7 triangular tiling.svg|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-5 heptagonal tiling honeycomb|{7,3,5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[5,3,7] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-7 dodecahedral honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). == Geometry== With [[Schläfli symbol]] {5,3,7}, it has seven [[dodecahedra]] {5,3} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many dodecahedra existing around each vertex in an [[order-7 triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=600 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 5-3-7 poincare cc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]

Ideal surface |} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It a part of a sequence of [[regular polytope]]s and honeycombs with [[Dodecahedron|dodecahedral]] [[cell (geometry)|cells]], {5,3,''p''}. {{Dodecahedral tessellations small}} It a part of a sequence of honeycombs {5,''p'',7}. It a part of a sequence of honeycombs {''p'',3,7}. {| class=wikitable ![[Order-7 tetrahedral honeycomb|{3,3,7}]] ![[Order-7 cubic honeycomb|{4,3,7}]] !{5,3,7} ![[Order-3-7 hexagonal honeycomb|{6,3,7}]] ![[Order-3-7 heptagonal honeycomb|{7,3,7}]] ![[Order-3-7 octagonal honeycomb|{8,3,7}]] ![[Order-3-7 aperiogonal honeycomb|{∞,3,7}]] |- |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 3-3-7 poincare cc.png|80px]] |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-3-7 poincare cc.png|80px]] |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 5-3-7 poincare cc.png|80px]] |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 6-3-7 poincare.png|80px]] |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 7-3-7 poincare.png|80px]] |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 8-3-7 poincare.png|80px]] |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb i-3-7 poincare.png|80px]] |} === Order-8 dodecahedral honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=320 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-8 dodecahedral honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{5,3,8}
{5,(3,4,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|8|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|5|node|3|node|8|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|5|node|split1|branch|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[dodecahedron|{5,3}]] [[File:Uniform polyhedron-53-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Octagon|{8}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Infinite-order triangular tiling|{3,8}]], {(3,4,3)}
[[File:H2 tiling 238-4.png|60px]][[File:H2 tiling 334-4.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-5 octagonal tiling honeycomb|{8,3,5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[5,3,8]
[5,((3,4,3))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-8 dodecahedral honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] {5,3,8}, it has eight [[dodecahedra]] {5,3} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many dodecahedra existing around each vertex in an [[order-8 triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 5-3-8 poincare cc.png|240px]]

[5,((3,∞,3))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''infinite-order dodecahedral honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). With [[Schläfli symbol]] {5,3,∞}. It has infinitely many [[dodecahedra]] {5,3} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many dodecahedra existing around each vertex in an [[infinite-order triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=600 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 5-3-i poincare cc.png|200px]]
